AD_Combat_SteelWatchers.speaker: Balthazar
AD_Combat_SteelWatchers.text: Unafraid of a fight - good. Perhaps we'll salvage your remains for a Steel Watcher.
AD_Combat_SteelWatchers.context: NodeContext: Taunting. 'I'm going to repurpose your corpse for one of my projects after I kill you'

PAD_MolEyepatch.speaker: Player
PAD_MolEyepatch.text: This is Mol's eyepatch - what's become of her?

DaisyAD_Balthazar.text: The necromancer was experimenting on the tadpoles.
But they were already imbued with Netherese magic - so where did that magic come from?

AD_ZombieErrand.speaker: Balthazar
AD_ZombieErrand.text: Too feeble by far. This needs muscle; the stronger, the better.
AD_ZombieErrand.context: NodeContext: Engrossed in his work, Ordering zombie lackeys about.

AD_ZombieErrandDone.speaker: Balthazar
AD_ZombieErrandDone.text: Stop dawdling - it's not as though you have somewhere better to be.

AD_Haruspicy.speaker: Balthazar
AD_Haruspicy.context: InternalNodeContext: Latin translation: "Marrow and blood..."NodeContext: meh-DOOH-lis et SAN-gwis

AD_Combat_ResendZombie.speaker: Balthazar
AD_Combat_ResendZombie.context: NodeContext: Urgent command to a zombie lackey during combat

session_synopses.AD_Combat_SteelWatchers: The necromancer is monologuing in combat.
session_synopses.PAD_MolEyepatch: The players may come across Mol's discarded eyepatch in the Necromancer Chamber in the Upper Colony. They will react to it appropriately, depending on whether they ever met Mol or not.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_Balthazar: On arrival in colony. On encountering Balthazar in room. The necromancer did experiments on the tadpoles here. We know they are magically manipulated. But how?
session_synopses.AD_ZombieErrand: The necromancer is standing over a bowl of blood and bone, conducting a ritual to see the future. He's sending zombies off on errands.
session_synopses.AD_ZombieErrandDone: The necromancer is standing over a bowl of blood and bone, conducting a ritual to see the future. He's sending zombies off on errands.The zombie returns, and he reacts.
session_synopses.AD_Haruspicy: The necromancer is standing over a bowl of blood and bone, conducting a ritual to see the future. This will trigger in the Necromancer's idle behavior if you entered through the main entrance while he is still alive OR after all zombies have been revived in the post-Audience combat and the players are still in the cages.For help with Latin, contact either Tom Ryckeboer or Ilya Voulis.
session_synopses.AD_Combat_ResendZombie: The necromancer is sending a zombie to light the candles that start an arcane ritual which drains the player's hitpoints and ultimately turns them into a zombie, after the player has extinguished them.

session_synopses.AD_Rapid01: Quick-fire Elder Brain ADs in the Colony corridors. If the party attacked Ketheric on the Moonrise Rooftop, there will be more frantic, fast-paced ADs from the Elder Brain surrounding us in quick succession, similar to when we approach the Elder Brain in the Morphic Pool. In this flow, the evacuation of the Colony is a lot more pressing because Ketheric was attacked.
session_synopses.AD_Whispers: While walking through Colony, the Elder Brain will whisper to you. The whispers are cued at specific triggers around the Colony, and will play only once. This AD can play anywhere in the Colony, except the Ketheric Showdown chamber and the hallway approaching it.Consider these ADs like a psychic intercom, the Elder Brain communicating with minions inside the Colony (thralls, illithids and Myrkulites alike). Most of the time, it will use its "Voice of the Absolute" to issue commands or rile up the troops, but sometimes the illithid side of the Elder Brain will slip through the cracks and address you, the player, directly, asking you to come and save it from the dominion of the Chosen Three.This AD is repeated on a timer, and will select the next available branch in sequence. The Logical Names of the greeting nodes refer to the areas in which these flags can be triggered, those areas being UPPER (upper floor)/LOWER (lower floor)/NEARBY (near the Ketheric Showdown chamber). ANY nodes can always be selected in any area.To only see a certain branch in the appropriate area, use the InArea flags, but make sure to add an additional greeting node without InArea flags that jumps to the next greeting node in the sequence, to prevent the AD sequence from getting stuck. Note that NEARBY and LOWER can overlap, so if you want something for lower only, make sure that InArea_Nearby is unchecked.The sequential selection of nodes is done using local flags and binary combinations of those flags.Any controlled player will be randomly selected for this AD, if they are available for dialog.These ADs play in random locations around the player upon whom the AD is played (use the COL_ElderBrainADs_Event_TeleportSpeaker flag on the upcoming speaker in a logic node for this, except for the greeting node).
session_synopses.AD_Rapid04: Quick-fire Elder Brain ADs in the Colony corridors. If the party attacked Ketheric on the Moonrise Rooftop, there will be more frantic, fast-paced ADs from the Elder Brain surrounding us in quick succession, similar to when we approach the Elder Brain in the Morphic Pool. In this flow, the evacuation of the Colony is a lot more pressing because Ketheric was attacked.
session_synopses.AD_Rapid02: Quick-fire Elder Brain ADs in the Colony corridors. If the party attacked Ketheric on the Moonrise Rooftop, there will be more frantic, fast-paced ADs from the Elder Brain surrounding us in quick succession, similar to when we approach the Elder Brain in the Morphic Pool. In this flow, the evacuation of the Colony is a lot more pressing because Ketheric was attacked.

DaisyAD_ThroughPrison.text: An illithid oubliette. Right beneath the Towers. A colony must be close. That must be where the tadpoles are coming from.

session_synopses.DaisyAD_ThroughPrison: On arrival in colony. Through prisonAn illithid colony. Right under the tower. This must be where they are getting the tadpoles.

PAD_BloodShower.speaker: Player
PAD_BloodShower.context:
NodeContext: Lae'zel line: sarcastic.
KAralch: Disgust

session_synopses.PAD: The player witnesses a bloody corpse rolling out of the chute in the Cleansing Room of the lower Mind Flayer Colony, coming in from the Oubliette. This PAD is their reaction to seeing this, and connecting it to Moonrise above.
session_synopses.PAD_BloodShower: A player reacts to getting splattered in blood and guts when they are standing below the corpse chute of the Colony Cleansing Room, when it is opened up. On the first time, a corpse will come falling out, but afterwards the chute simply serves as a blood shower at the press of the button.

PAD_BrinePool.speaker: Player
PAD_BrinePool.text: No tadpoles in this brine pool.

session_synopses.PAD_BrinePool: A PAD reacting to the brine pool in the Tadpoling Centre in the Colony. The player will interact with the brine pool and play this dialog. If a player succeeds a perception check and fishes out the last remaining tadpole, a different node will be played.

Butcher_FreedUs.speaker: Chop
Butcher_FreedUs.text: NO! Creature was wrong - Other. But mine to fix.

Butcher_FreedUs.speaker: Chop
Butcher_FreedUs.text: ... no. Please. I hear. I obey.
Butcher_FreedUs.context: NodeContext: Broken - wilting under the threat of punishment from us

AD_Butcher_CombatEnter.speaker: Chop
AD_Butcher_CombatEnter.text: Living meat? Not for long. Time for chop.
AD_Butcher_CombatEnter.context: NodeContext: Aggressive. Challenging the player as he enters combat against them.

AD_Butcher_Idle.speaker: Chop
AD_Butcher_Idle.text: Pretty faces go chop... faces? No - no faces, only meat. Never think, never stop. Only chop. Chop. CHOP.
AD_Butcher_Idle.context: NodeContext: Brief note of lucidity on '...faces?' as he seems momentarily aware of his condition - then shakes it off and returns to his work rhythm a little more forcefully.

AD_Butcher_CombatTurn002.speaker: Chop
AD_Butcher_CombatTurn002.text: Kill me. No more voices. No more red. Only peace. Only dead.
AD_Butcher_CombatTurn002.context: NodeContext: Anguished moment of lucidity cried out during combat. Wants to be put out of his misery,

session_synopses.Butcher_FreedUs: Crime reaction for Chop, the Colony Butcher, after we either free Us from its cage, mess with the cage or kill Us.
session_synopses.AD_Butcher_CombatEnter: This AD plays during combat with Chop, the Colony Butcher. Chop will fight you because he is enthralled, but has a secret desire to be put out of his misery.
session_synopses.AD_Butcher_Idle: Sequential, repeated AD for Chop, the Colony butcher. He will say a line every few seconds while in his idle behaviour. Chop is generally enjoying his job, but something deep beneath his enthralled exterior realizes the horror of his reality. Some of these lines could be considered a little bit song-like - Chop would be humming to himself while working.
session_synopses.AD_Butcher_CombatTurn002: This AD plays during combat with Chop, the Colony Butcher. Chop will fight you because he is enthralled, but has a secret desire to be put out of his misery.

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: You said it was under control.
ChosenThree.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric and Gortash stand by the chamber's centre, squaring off. Nearby, Orin completes the circle, sitting at her leisure on Ravengard by the brine pool.

ChosenThree.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree.text: It isn't you I answer to, Gortash.

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: Oh, the General voice. Is this where we salute?

ChosenThree.speaker: Orin
ChosenThree.text: Salute, yes, with cleavers through his blood-starved flesh. How it crawls with failure like flies on lick-wet carrion.

ChosenThree.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree.text: You forget yourself, Orin. I have played my part.

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: You've built an army for our masters, true enough. But what of the Astral Prism?

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: A rogue True Soul, flaunting it under your nose all this time. And you ran from them.

ChosenThree.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree.text: Sure that they would follow, and deliver it into my hands here. If you would cease these distractions -

DaisyAD_ElderBrain.text: An elder brain... One of the cruellest and most powerful creatures in existence, enslaved by mere mortals.

DaisyAD_EntranceDoor.text: We've found it. The Absolute is behind this door.

PAD_NightsongCaged.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongCaged.text: So long as Nightsong's in that cage, Ketheric will keep getting back up.

AD_Phase3Transition.text: UNLIFE TO MY LIFE - SUSTAIN ME, SLAVES.

AD_NightsongApostle.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongApostle.text: Now you wear a face to match your soul, oathbreaker.
AD_NightsongApostle.context: NodeContext: Scorn in the heat of battle - her nemesis has just turned into a hideous monster

PAD_AfterCombatComment.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterCombatComment.text: The Chosen of Myrkul is dead - permanently, this time.
PAD_AfterCombatComment.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's distracted. More focused on Gortash.

AD_NightsongAfterCombat.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: Scorn in the heat of battle - her nemesis has just turned into a hideous monster

session_synopses.ChosenThree: Upon entering the Ketheric boss chamber on the lower floor of the Colony, the party will see a cinematic of the Chosen Three gearing up to continue on to the next stage of their master plan. Ketheric, Orin and Gortash will be discussing the next steps and the tension caused by the player's actions. Ketheric tadpoles Duke Ravengard and we lay eyes upon the Elder Brain in the flesh. Orin and Gortash depart with the Duke and the Elder Brain in a nearby Nautiloid to march onto Baldur's Gate. We see the Nautiloid appear above Moonrise Towers and cue the armies of the Absolute to start marching. Ketheric stays behind to deal with some local issues.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_ElderBrain: The Elder Brain. One of the cruelest and most powerful creatures that exist. Subservient to those three. And those gems seem to be the key. We must obtain them.
session_synopses.PAD_NightsongCaged: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, while the combat has started and Nightsong is still soul caged. The players must free her before Ketheric can be damaged. Once the first (speaker available) player gets their turn in combat, this AD will play on them.
session_synopses.AD_Phase3Transition: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when the third phase of the fight starts, this will play only once on Ketheric when his turn starts. Ketheric, in his Apostle of Myrkul form, calls upon the Necromites to sacrifice themselves to heal him.
session_synopses.AD_NightsongApostle: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, after Ketheric has transformed into his Apostle form/reached his second stage, Nightsong will react to this upon her first combat turn after this.
session_synopses.PAD_AfterCombatComment: A PAD commenting on defeating Ketheric in his Apostle form at the end of the mind flayer Colony. After this the player will say that they need to go discuss the next course of action with their allies (alluding to Intermezzo in Moonrise Tower).At this point the players should take Ketheric's Netherstone (but we can't ensure that a player hasn't already looted said netherstone off his corpse by the time that end node is played).If there are two players available, they will banter together, otherwise a solo PAD will play.
session_synopses.AD_KethericCommandTroops: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when Ketheric uses his "Command Troops" ability to make his minions focus their efforts on attacking a specific target. This will only happen during the first phase, in Ketheric's human form.
session_synopses.AD_NightsongAfterCombat: This dialogue will play when interacting with Nightsong after the Ketheric Showdown combat at the end of the Colony.

AD_IntellectDevourer.text: She calls! She sings! She... mourns?
AD_IntellectDevourer.context: NodeContext: Brief slip of the mask - the hivemind realising something is wrong

session_synopses.AD_IntellectDevourer: The player talks a neutral intellect devourer in the mind flayer colony (this dialogue is shared between all the intellect devourers in the kitchen area).

PAD_RitualArea.speaker: Player
PAD_RitualArea.text: Curious setup. Think I'll keep my distance.

AD_Zombie.speaker: Cal, Danis, Dror Ragzlin, GROUP_Act2_COL_NecromancerZombies, Lakrissa, Lia, Nickels, Nightwarden Minthara, Nimble, Wulbren Bongle

session_synopses.PAD_RitualArea: The players come upon a ritual setup where subjects are captured and held in glass containers while the magic drains their life and turns them into undead.
session_synopses.AD_Zombie: The player interacts with a zombie in the necromancer's lab,

AudienceTentacle.speaker: Narrator
AudienceTentacle.text: *A giant stalk of flesh rests before you, fibrous tendrils snaking up and away into darkness. It pulses like a living, breathing thing.*

AudienceTentacle.speaker: Narrator
AudienceTentacle.text: *It is alive. Your tadpole echoes awareness - and the deep, savage fury of a wild thing caged.*

AudienceTentacle.speaker: Narrator
AudienceTentacle.text: *This being - the colony itself - burns to rage, to tear these impostors from its core. And instead it rests, like a docile pet.*

session_synopses.AudienceTentacle: An interaction with a huge tentacle that is psychically connected to the Elder Brain. Will only appear at the Colony's Moonrise Assault entrance if we came from the Necro-Lab - the tentacle won't have broken through Moonrise Tower. The tentacle will disappear again once the Elder Brain departs.A psionic pulse will emanate from the tentacle when we approach it, and we will get psychically told some personal history from the Elder Brain.

AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.text: *Desperation... pain... terror. Cultists raided his village - he was the sole survivor.*

AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer.text: *The device does not react to your presence.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *You remember the shattered windows of Elturel's High Cathedral, the burning black sky of Avernus beyond.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *In its horror, the Blood War unites you. Tiefling, dwarf and elf alike huddle behind the shields of your paladin order, waiting for salvation. But when it comes... disunity.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *The returned city casts your people out, the devils who dragged them down to hell. In the end, it is not your paladin oath that is broken: it is your faith itself.*

Pods.speaker: Narrator
Pods.text: *You connect to the device, and gain control of the pods - and the fate of their occupants.*

Pods.speaker: Narrator
Pods.text: *The device is open to your tadpole's command - to your authority.*

PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole.speaker: Player
PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole.text: An unusual parasite, here. It's - it's reaching out to me.

AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.text: *Courage... conviction... defiance. Even as her organs began to dissolve, she believed she could resist.*

AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.text: *Delirium... mania... laughter. His mind broke before the end, and he was laughing uncontrollably as the skin fell from his face.*

DaisyAD_BrinePool.text: Brine pools... but empty of tadpoles. Unusual. Harvesting all the larvae indicates they are getting ready for something big.

AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty.text: *The device does not react to your presence.*

PAD_MizoraPodComment.speaker: Player
PAD_MizoraPodComment.text: That pod - is that Mizora inside?

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.text: *Your lungs burn with the dry heat of the fires raging about you, but the pain is not enough to diminish your swing. One goblin after another falls to your blade.*

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.text: *A man's voice cries out through the thick smoke. 'Ravengard!' you call, but the clang of swords and the spell-shouts of attacking drow are your only reply.*

AD_MemoryImprint_002_Manip.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_002_Manip.text: *This pod pulsates with the angry memories of Ravengard's search officer, Manip Shuurga. She laments her failure to locate him.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.text: *Though the pod is empty, traces of psychic energy still linger around it, and memories of its former inhabitant spill into your mind.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.text: *You see the streets of Baldur's Gate... the emblem of the Flaming Fist... martial drills and courtly dances.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.text: *You feel the courage of a soldier who became a commander, and the intelligence of a commander who became a Duke.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.text: *Ravengard was here, in this pod, not long ago.*

AD_Manip_ColonyComment.speaker: Manip Shuurga
AD_Manip_ColonyComment.text: That smell - I can feel it in my throat. I'll never be rid of it.

AD_Manip_ColonyComment.speaker: Manip Shuurga
AD_Manip_ColonyComment.text: There'll be hells to pay for this, if I make it out of here alive.

session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer: AD for a memory imprint on an empty pod in the Tadpoling Centre.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor: AD for Zevlor's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from before he was imprisoned here.
session_synopses.Pods: Interacting with the mind flayer device in the Tadpoling Centre that controls the pods inside. You get to choose whether to free or purge the occupants of the pods - mind flayers and innocents alike.
session_synopses.PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole: The party reacts to spotting a special tadpole in one of the brine pools of the Colony Tadpoling Centre. It can be used for the tadpole powers tree.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_BrinePool: Brine pools. But they’ve been harvested. They should be full of tadpoles.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty: AD for an empty pod's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from whoever was imprisoned here before.
session_synopses.PAD_MizoraPodComment: Players comment when approaching Mizora's pod in the back of the Tadpoling Centre, provided she is there.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva: AD for Flaming Fist Yeva's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from before she was imprisoned here.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_002_Manip: AD for Shuurga's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from before she was imprisoned here.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard: AD for an empty pod's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from Duke Ravengard, who was imprisoned here before.
session_synopses.AD_Manip_ColonyComment: Behaviour AD from the Flaming Fist Manip after she is released from her pod in the mind flayer Colony's Tadpoling Centre. After the mind flayers are defeated, she will eventually make this comment about her surroundings.

AD_SkullLasher_001_Combat.speaker: Hairy Henry
AD_SkullLasher_001_Combat.text: You will beg for death long before we grant it!

AD_SkullLasher_003_Combat.speaker: Maghtew Budj
AD_SkullLasher_003_Combat.text: I shall make sweet music of your screams!

AD_SkullLasher_001_Prayer.speaker: Hairy Henry
AD_SkullLasher_001_Prayer.text: All that live are yours, Myrkul. Let us hasten them on their journey.
AD_SkullLasher_001_Prayer.context: NodeContext: praying to the god of death

session_synopses.AD_SkullLasher_001_Combat: Hairy Henry, one of three Skull Lashers in the Colony Barracks, combat AD. Played only once.
session_synopses.AD_SkullLasher_003_Combat: Magthew Budj, a human male, one of three Skull Lashers in the Colony Barracks, combat AD. Played only once.
session_synopses.AD_SkullLasher_001_Prayer: Hairy Henry, a male bugbear, one of three Skull Lashers in the Colony Barracks, repeated behaviour AD for when he is praying to Myrkul. He is preparing for war in the Absolute's army.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: A whole fleet of nautiloids. How many 'True Souls' have passed through this place?

session_synopses.PAD: While exploring the Colony, a player arrives at a precipice from which they can see a row of floating nautiloids.

Puzzle.speaker: Narrator
Puzzle.text: *As the console bursts into life, a mind touches your own. Alien and full of desperate need - but fragmented, too.*
Puzzle.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of puzzle space as it winks into existence

Puzzle.speaker: Narrator
Puzzle.text: *It is... incomplete. It yearns to connect - but needs you to guide the process, linking each part of your mind to its like.*
Puzzle.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the starting point of the player's mind, and the ending point of the machine's, with all the unconnected paths in between.

PAD_GrandDesign.speaker: Gale
PAD_GrandDesign.text: I wonder, how did the Illithid Empire fall?

PAD_GrandDesign.speaker: Karlach, Lae'zel, Shadowheart
PAD_GrandDesign.text: Probably with a great gooey bang.

AD_Solving.speaker: Mind of the Vault
AD_Solving.context: InternalNodeContext: Partial lucidity (3 out of 3 brain parts activated; fully lucid in following lines as puzzle is now solved)NodeContext: Mechanically distorted speech; almost "normal"

session_synopses.Puzzle: This dialog plays when interacting with the button at the Colony Vault. It is an interaction with the mind within the illithid machine. Only companions with a tadpole may interact with the machine, or they will be denied access.Interacting with the mind allows the player to start solving the puzzle, reset the puzzle or talk to it after the puzzle is solved. When it is solved, the mind considers you its master, and you can ask it to do things like open or close the vaults (which contain rewards), show you a map of the Colony or "shatter" the mind to its original state.
session_synopses.AD_Solving: AD occasionally played as the player solves the puzzle, providing feedback to the player.

PAD_ElevatorBanter.speaker: Player
PAD_ElevatorBanter.text: Is anyone else's tadpole squirming around a lot more than usual?

PAD_ElevatorBanter.speaker: Player
PAD_ElevatorBanter.text: Aye. Feels like something down here has them excited... or scared.

session_synopses.PAD_CallLiftFail: The player has tried to call the platform in COL while it's already at the level in question.
session_synopses.PAD_ElevatorBanter: A banter PAD when taking the elevator down to the Ketheric Showdown from the upper floor of the Colony. If there are two tadpoled players available, they will banter together, otherwise a solo PAD will play.

session_synopses.ResonanceStone_PAD: The players react to gaining or losing the "Eldritch Pleasure" status effect from the Resonance Stone in the secret sideroom of the Colony kitchen/dissection room. This status is applied or removed upon gaining the "Eldritch Pleasure" buff bestowed by the aura effect of the Resonance Stone, and will only play once per user and nearby player. The removal dialog will only trigger upon losing the buff while inside a trigger near the Colony kitchen, as to avoid it playing unexpectedly during later parts of the game.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Looks like it siphons power from anyone lying in that cradle. Wonderful.

session_synopses.PAD: Players are trying to use a recovery pod (like in the tutorial) that's disabled because there's nobody in the attached bed (or pod, art still TBD).

AD_Minthara_WitnessedBrainDevice.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_WitnessedBrainDevice.text: A splendid device. All the benefits of a cleric, no gods required.

PAD_ToBaldursGate.speaker: Player
PAD_ToBaldursGate.text: The road to Baldur's Gate is west of the town. If we hurry, we'll arrive before the Absolute's forces.

PAD_CurseStateComment.speaker: Player
PAD_CurseStateComment.text: The shadow curse will soon be forgotten, thanks to us.

PAD_UnfinishedBusiness.speaker: Player
PAD_UnfinishedBusiness.text: The road to Baldur's Gate is up ahead. No turning back, once we start down that road.

session_synopses.PAD_ToBaldursGate: After leaving Ketheric's throne room after Ketheric's defeat, a player character comments on what they need to do next - head for Baldur's Gate.
session_synopses.PAD_CurseStateComment: After the act 2 epilogue, the party comments on the state of the Shadow Curse before leaving for Baldur's Gate.
session_synopses.PAD_UnfinishedBusiness: After the act 2 epilogue, the party comments on resolving unfinished business before moving on to Baldur's Gate/act 3.

AD_JaheiraAndMinthara.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraAndMinthara.text: Is it true you were a member of the Absolute cult, drow?

AD_JaheiraAndMinthara.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_JaheiraAndMinthara.text: Do you mean to judge me if I were, darthiir?

AD_JaheiraAndMinthara.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraAndMinthara.text: No. I mean to learn from you.

session_synopses.AD_JaheiraAndMinthara: If Florrick is not present and Minthara is, Jaheira will approach to keep an eye on her. She can not be trusted yet since she was recently with the Absolute.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: Back in Last Light, I was racking my brains - how the hells do we get past the curse?

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: And then, a blinding light cuts through the darkness, like a blade through butter. All thanks to you, I hear.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: Didn't think we'd make it without the old Hellrider to lead us. But you did a damn fine job.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Nightsong's the real hero here - she was the light in the darkness.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: You're too humble.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: But the best leaders know they're only as good as the people around them. Zevlor told me that.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: Turns out the people around him were better than him. Guess he got what was coming to him.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Good riddance.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: I wish things had ended differently for him.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: There are less mouths to feed now, but we still need supplies for the road. We'll scavenge what we can.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: Hopefully we'll see you again in the city.

session_synopses: Cerys is preparing to lead the surviving tieflings onwards to Baldur’s Gate. Shocked to have survived the Shadow-Cursed Lands, she finds herself taking responsibility for the others - in Zevlor’s absence. It’s not a role she ever wanted, but somebody has to do it. She’s adjusting to a life without Zevlor, and briefly reflects on his surrender and presumed death.

001.speaker: Flaming Fist
001.text: We need to move. The city's in danger.

001.speaker: Nimble
001.text: I can't believe Wulbren's gone. Reviving the Ironhands, returning to Baldur's Gate - it all rested on him.

001.speaker: Nimble
001.text: Gods. What will I tell the others?

session_synopses.001: Eagerly awaiting the next steps from their leader Wulbren. Ready to do whatever he directs. If Wulbren's dead they'll be noticably more downbeat.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I found Mol's eyepatch.

node_data.speaker: Umi
node_data.text: What? Where is she?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Rising tearful panic

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Hey, calm down - I'm sure she just dropped it. Mol's fine, I promise.

node_data.speaker: Umi
node_data.text: You think so? Mol is really clever. I hope she finds us again soon.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hovering on the brink of tears despite the player's reassurances

session_synopses: Umi is upset by Mol's absence and is just barely holding it together (despite Alfira's best attempts).

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I found Mol's eyepatch.

node_data.speaker: Ide
node_data.text: This is Mol's... Where did you find it?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Almost accusatory

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Somewhere unpleasant. But I didn't see Mol - she's probably safe somewhere.

node_data.speaker: Ide
node_data.text: 'Course she is! You hang onto that - I bet Mol'll be angry at you for touching her stuff.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Defiant but secretly a little relieved - she's glad the player didn't say Mol was dead

session_synopses: Ide is frustrated by Alfira's attempts to cheer her and the other tiefling kids up - she's more worried about Mol (who is missing).

node_data.speaker: Halsin
node_data.text: Thaniel still suffers. There'll be no improvement until his essence is restored, I fear.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

node_data.speaker: Halsin
node_data.text: Only, the missing half may not come willingly. The curse will have sunk its tendrils deep, twisting Thaniel's essence into something... else.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Some foreboding. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: All right, leave it to me.

node_data.speaker: Halsin
node_data.text: This doesn't have to be your burden alone. Every moment counts, and I've asked much of you already without being at your side.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Stalwart, heartfelt

node_data.speaker: Halsin
node_data.text: If you want me, I'm yours. Against the curse, against the Absolute - anything. Just say the word.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Stalwart, heartfelt

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Join me.

node_data.speaker: Halsin
node_data.text: Good. Now our roots can deepen - together.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Resolute/comradely

session_synopses: Dialogue with Halsin in the epilogue of Act 2. In it, he reacts to the various states that could occur in relation to his desire to rid the Act 2 region of the shadow curse:- if you've already done everything needed to ensure success. he's grateful and seeks to remain with you on the journey to Baldur's Gate.- if the curse is not yet sure to be lifted, but there's still something that can be done (ie Thaniel was saved from the Shadowfell, but hasn't been fully restored), he will implore the players to help and offer to join them.- if it's no longer possible to lift the curse, Halsin is sad and resigned to staying behind to stand sentry over it. He will not be available as a companion in Act 3, and his story effectively ends here.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: You have defeated Ketheric Thorm, yet you who were content to leave Dame Aylin in his thrall until it served you best. How do you account for it?

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: Isobel is dead. But you live - you who were content to leave me in the thrall of foul Ketheric Thorm.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I apologise. It was wrong of me to leave you in Ketheric's clutches.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: Aye, it was. It was a failure I won't soon forget. Still, you are no lost cause, are you?

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: It takes a lion's heart to admit such a terrible mistake. I will forgive you, in time.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: I am Dame Aylin. Daughter of the Moonmaiden, Selûne; champion of her causes in this fine realm.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: If you seek to protect it, our aims are aligned - even if you've much to learn about the methods of a true champion.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: I will join your camp, that we may discuss what must needs be discussed.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I don't think so. Our journey together ends here.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: You would deny Dame Aylin, daughter of the Moonmaiden, paladin of the selfsame Selûne?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I would.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: Reject the moon, if it be your will. It will not stop her from lending you her light. Good day.

session_synopses: The player has a chance to catch up with Nightsong if she survived Act 2, and Isobel is dead

AD_EpilogueIntro.speaker: Jaheira
AD_EpilogueIntro.text: I've been thinking on all that you learned below. If you've caught your breath, we ought to discuss our next steps.

session_synopses.AD_EpilogueIntro: Jaheira AD's on returning back from the confrontation with Ketheric (If there). To draw attention to the player and encourage them to speak with her. Also going to use this to address that the player could do with recruiting her again if they did before.

AD_MainGateFlamingFists.speaker: Flaming Fist
AD_MainGateFlamingFists.text: I ought to do the rounds again.

AD_MainGateFlamingFists.speaker: Flaming Fist
AD_MainGateFlamingFists.text: No point. Everyone's wrecked. Leave 'em be.

session_synopses.AD_MainGateFlamingFists: Two flaming fists at the main gate of MOO are guarding it and discussing how finally they will be able to leave the cursed lands and go back to Baldur's Gate, and that they didn't think they would make it.

NimbleAndNickels.speaker: Nimble
NimbleAndNickels.text: You need to eat before we head off, all right?

NimbleAndNickels.speaker: Nimble
NimbleAndNickels.text: Do you have anything to eat?
NimbleAndNickels.context: NodeContext: suspicious, realising nickles answered too easily

Mattis.speaker: Mattis
Mattis.text: Just focus on packing - don't think about Mol.

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: It's finally time for the Ironhand Gnomes to come home.
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: eager, excited to return to the city

session_synopses.NimbleAndNickels: Back and forth between nimble and nickels in the tower.
session_synopses.Mattis: In the top nodes, the player has shown Mattis mol's eyepatch - implying that she's dead. He's distracted and just trying to focus on packing and getting ready - even though he's worried for Mol. In the bottom, he's eager to go and is scavaging Moonrise for stuff he can sell.
session_synopses.Wulbren: These ADs occur in the epilogue. In one set, Wulbren is admiring the stonework in front of him, and contemplating the artistry of Moonrise Towers. In the other, it's his idle behaviour as he prepares to leave for Baldur's Gate - excited for his plans to all come together.
session_synopses.Nickels: Nickels is alive but his friend and caretaker Nimble is dead. He's lost without her and out of sorts.

000.speaker: Flaming Fist
000.text: Safe return to the city. We'll see you there, Helm willing.

Debrief.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Debrief.text: | Ketheric is defeated, but his army marches on. To rid ourselves of this parasite, we will have to give chase. |

session_synopses.Debrief: Minthara is present and gives the debrief to the player after the mindflayer colony.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: You helped me escape this hellspit, then took down the heart of Moonrise - Ketheric himself. I'm impressed.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: And I'm not a man easily impressed.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I believe the words you're looking for are 'thank you'.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: I was getting to that, but all right - thank you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: a touch annoyed

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: Back in my cell, I didn't tell you everything - about who I was, and more importantly, who I represent.
node_data.context: NodeContext: sincere

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: I am Wulbren Bongle, leader of the Ironhand Gnomes. No doubt you've heard of us?
node_data.context: NodeContext: said with immense pride

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recall stories of the Ironhand Gnomes - a talented group of inventors who were banished from Baldur's Gate.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Go on. I'm sure you're dying to tell me all about the Ironhand Gnomes.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: We are inventors of the highest order, matched, perhaps, but never surpassed by the Gondians at the High House of Wonders.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: But our forebears were foolish - complicit with Sarevok's madness over a century past, and so we were banished. Still are to this day.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Pity he never succeeded.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: You agree with such machinations? Duly noted.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: I've fought tooth and nail to restore our reputation. Particularly against Gondian detractors who live in glass houses.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: I've filled appeals - pleaded with the High Artificer himself. They've refused us time and again. Now, however, I will make them listen.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Is there anything I can do to help?

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: Plenty. Find me in the city, and help us save Baldur's Gate from itself.

session_synopses: This dialogue is peak Wulbren. If he's met you in haven (after you saved him), he rolls back on how rude he was as he realises the player would be an amazing asset in the city. If this is your first time meeting him since the escape (if haven is destroyed he waits out on the river until this scene in the epilogue), he realises how good the player would be to have on his side in the city and tells him all about how wronged the ironhand gnomes were.

node_data.speaker: His Majesty
node_data.text: *Hiss!*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cat hisses at the player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Here, kitty kitty.
True
CinematicNodeContext: Player crouches down on haunches and holds out hand in a 'here kitty kitty' way
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player crouches down on haunches and holds out hand in a 'here kitty kitty' way

node_data.speaker: His Majesty
node_data.text: *Rrreow...*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cat doesn't approach, but meows in a non-threatening (though still wary) way

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Reach out to pet the cat.

node_data.speaker: His Majesty
node_data.text: *HISS!*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cat rears back in a defensive stance and hisses at the player, maybe even swipes paws if it's possibe.

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: Chk. Why would anyone keep such neurotic creatures as pets?

session_synopses: Cat is hanging around Barcus' workshop. Cat is not very friendly and player won't really be able to change the cat into being friendly, only temporarily not-aggro. If the player intimidates the cat, they can convince the cat to leave into the shadowcurse. Might do followup in future but none planned now. If placated, cat will tell player not to trust Isobel.

Combat_FlamingFist_005.speaker: Fist Gretta
Combat_FlamingFist_005.text: I'm going home to Baldur's Gate with your blood on my tunic.

Intro.speaker: Jaheira
Intro.text: Do you understand what you've done? Without Isobel, everyone in this inn is as good as dead!

Intro.speaker: Jaheira
Intro.text: I trusted you. Silvanus forgive me, I let you in.

Outro.text: InternalNodeContext: Player and Jaheira gather in Haven yard after combat.
Outro.context: InternalNodeContext: Player and Jaheira gather in Haven yard after combat.

Outro.speaker: Jaheira
Outro.text: It's all over. They're all gone. My brave ones, my friends, my Harpers.

Outro.speaker: Jaheira
Outro.text: I led them here - to this.
Outro.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) On ‘to this' she waves her arm signalling the carnage all around.

Outro.speaker: Player
Outro.text: Get a grip. This isn't over yet.

Outro.speaker: Jaheira
Outro.text: After such carnage you'd persist? Sometimes there's folly in such courage.

Outro.speaker: Player
Outro.text: Then by all means I'm a fool. But I'm not giving up.

Outro.speaker: Jaheira
Outro.text: Perhaps it's right that you're not. You're twice blessed after all: by Isobel and by your artefact. But as for myself, I don't see another option than to make a desperate dash back to Baldur's Gate.

Outro.speaker: Jaheira
Outro.text: Chances are slim I'd survive the journey back, but if I can warn the dukes an army of Absolutists is on the march, perhaps the city still stands a fighting chance.

Outro.speaker: Player
Outro.text: In that case, good luck and godsspeed.

Outro.speaker: Jaheira
Outro.text: Thank you, truly. May you succeed where I have failed. You are the stuff of legends now. Pray that I live to tell your tale.

session_synopses.Intro: Huge cinematic showing start of the Shadow Siege. Jaheira assesses the situation with the players, urgently, as darkness takes over the inn. Then a legion of shadows tear the guards apart as everyone else flees, and the party emerges to fight.
session_synopses.Outro: After the battle against the shadows is over, we speak with Jaheira again. Either she hates us because she knows we killed Isobel, or she's contemplative in the aftermath of the battle, and we can have her join our camp.

Lanceboard_AD.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_AD.text: This game's awful. Why's anyone play it?
Lanceboard_AD.context: NodeContext: pretending to be bad at the game (she's actually amazing at it)

Lanceboard_AD.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_AD.text: It hones a strategic mind, my dear. Take your turn.

Lanceboard_AD.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_AD.context: NodeContext: pretending to be bad at the game (she's actually amazing at it)

RaphaelWaiting.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelWaiting.text: Sorry, I have an appointment with someone far more interesting than you. We'll speak soon.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael watches in cold amusement as Mol grips one of the pieces, clearly anxious.NodeContext: Says the cat to the mouse

Lanceboard_ThreeWay.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay.text: You trapped me. I didn't even want to take this one.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay.text: Calimshan rules, dear. The first piece touched is the first piece moved.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay.text: That's garbage. No matter where the knight goes, I'm gonna lose it.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay.text: Then make the sacrifice useful. Guard your Mystra, or come for my Cyric.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay.speaker: Karlach
Lanceboard_ThreeWay.context: NodeContext: Suspicious, happening upon Raphael and Mol (tween crime lord) playing chess together.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay.text: Hey! What's a big hero like you doing in a dustheap like this?
Lanceboard_ThreeWay.context: CinematicNodeContext: <pre> Mol's face goes intense with concentration. She notices being watched by the player, and smiles, surprised.

AD_MonitorLeave.speaker: Raphael
AD_MonitorLeave.text: If you'll excuse me, I must see to urgent matters.

AD_MonitorLeave.speaker: Raphael
AD_MonitorLeave.text: But don't you fret. I shall always find time for my most treasured acquaintance.

AD_NoticedStolenBoard.speaker: Mol
AD_NoticedStolenBoard.text: Huh. Just put this away a second ago... didn't I?

session_synopses.Lanceboard_AD: ADs for Mol and Raphael as they play lanceboard. Mol is pretending to be unskilled and disinterested in the game.
session_synopses.Lanceboard_ThreeWay: The player comes across Mol and Raphael playing a game of lanceboard (Forgotten Realms chess). The devil is clearly beating Mol, but with the player's help, she can win.Cinematic Notes: Mol and Raphael are sitting down throughout this entire scene. Raphael teleports out of his seat at the end and is no longer on screen.
session_synopses.AD_MonitorLeave: AD spoken by Raphael as he stands to leave after playing chess with Mol.
session_synopses.AD_NoticedStolenBoard: Mol reacts to the player having stolen and put the lanceboard elsewhere.

Reunited.speaker: Bex
Reunited.text: You're all right. My gods, you're all right!
Reunited.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danis and Bex facing each other

Reunited.speaker: Danis
Reunited.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danis and Bex embrace completely. They are so fckn happy to be reunited after Danis was taken to MOO. They end their hug and gaze into each others' eyes at the end of the node

Reunited.speaker: Player
Reunited.text: A beautiful sight, and all thanks to me.

Reunited.speaker: Danis
Reunited.text: Credit where it's due - Bex, this is the one who helped me and the others escape.
Reunited.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Credit where it's due" turns to player
"Bex' - Danis places hand on Bex's shoulder and looks at her
"This is the one who helped me" alternates between player and Bex to make introductionsNodeContext: With a chuckle, super happy and amused by the player even though player's being a prick

Reunited.speaker: Bex
Reunited.text: This isn't the first time you've helped us - saved our lives, really. Why?
Reunited.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bex breaks away and steps toward player, looks at them closely.

Reunited.speaker: Player
Reunited.text: It was the right thing to do.

Reunited.speaker: Bex
Reunited.text: How lucky we are to have met you. I believe you're the noblest person I've ever known.

Reunited.speaker: Danis
Reunited.context: NodeContext: Mock hurt, as in 'I thought I was the noblest person you've ever known'

Reunited.speaker: Bex
Reunited.text: You are. And we'll never forget it - never ever.
Reunited.context: NodeContext: Smiling about silly Danis making a joke of everything. Stage whisper the 'You are'.

Reunited.speaker: Bex
Reunited.text: Here - take these for the road. It's the least I can do.
Reunited.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands the player an item off-camera

session_synopses.Reunited: Danis and Bex are reunited in the Last Light Inn after the player has saved Danis from being trapped in MOO. The two are ecstatic to see one another for the first time in a long time and very grateful to the player.

AD_Combat_Jaheira_000.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Combat_Jaheira_000.text: You should have stayed in your tower.

AD_OutsideSignPost.speaker: Narrator
AD_OutsideSignPost.text: *For a warm bed and full stomach, look no further. Welcome to the Last Light Inn.*
AD_OutsideSignPost.context: NodeContext: a sign for an inn

session_synopses.AD_OutsideSignPost: This signpost is located just outside of the last ligh inn.

node_data.text: Heading out without Isobel's blessing? Have you got a death wish?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Far from it - thanks for the reminder.
Hate to see the shadows get you before you've begun. Good luck.

session_synopses: Could be one of a number of Last Light guards who sees you leaving without getting the blessing from Isobel and calls out to you to remind you.

AD_LoverInspection.speaker: Danis
AD_LoverInspection.text: We have to worry about parasites now? Gods.

AD_BrotherInspection.speaker: Danis
AD_BrotherInspection.text: I would tell you if I had one, I swear it!

AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.speaker: Manip Vidor
AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.text: J'ehlar is doing her best, but he shows no signs of waking.

AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.text: If you have an alternative in mind, please do propose it.

AD_WulbrenInspection.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_WulbrenInspection.text: This is ridiculous - as if I'd let some parasite infect me.
AD_WulbrenInspection.context: NodeContext: Loathing in his voice at the thought

FlirtyTiefling.speaker: Lakrissa
FlirtyTiefling.text: The light - it's happening. Ketheric is about to get a long overdue arse-kicking - I can feel it.

AD_SisterInspection.speaker: Lia
AD_SisterInspection.text: Can we hurry this up? I need a drink. Now.
AD_SisterInspection.context: NodeContext: annoyed and a little nervous

FlamingFist_001.speaker: Fist Thadwick
FlamingFist_001.text: This is no place for amateurs.
FlamingFist_001.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: now annoyed that player is talking again

FlamingFist_002.speaker: Fist Aubree
FlamingFist_002.text: I've heard the stories about Moonrise. I hope the Duke is all right.
FlamingFist_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: <GL> reshoot, last version had almost no movementInternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: concerned

FlamingFist_003.speaker: Fist Rahir
FlamingFist_003.text: Nothing to be done here. The Duke's in the Towers.
FlamingFist_003.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: strict but coming from a good place

Arrival.speaker: Narrator
Arrival.text: *You drift through the dark until time, skill, or luck brings you to Last Light's dock.*
Arrival.context: CinematicNodeContext: Screen is black. As the narration ends, it fades up to reveal players and prisoners standing on the dock with the Harper walking towards them

Arrival.speaker: Harper Arthus
Arrival.text: Hold there! You can't just land and start unloading strangers - there are procedures, damn it.

Arrival.speaker: Harper Arthus
Arrival.text: No one gets in without being tested - Commander Jaheira's orders.

Arrival.speaker: Player
Arrival.text: I passed your damn test already. I remember the vines vividly.

Arrival.speaker: Harper Arthus
Arrival.text: You did, but your friends did not.

Arrival.speaker: Harper Arthus
Arrival.text: Anyone could be infected, so we're checking all new faces. No exceptions.

Arrival.speaker: Harper Arthus
Arrival.text: Here, form a line. Let's see if the Absolute's little pet recognises any of you.
Arrival.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the escapees from the boat

AD_Gnome02Inspection.speaker: Nickels
AD_Gnome02Inspection.text: I want to go inside - to the wood and stone. Where it's quiet - safe.

FlamingFist_004.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
FlamingFist_004.text: A hundred years locked away inside a curse - can you imagine?
FlamingFist_004.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.

AD_Gnome01Inspection.speaker: Nimble
AD_Gnome01Inspection.text: This is a waste of time - I certainly don't have one.

AD_FlamingFist_003_InCombat.speaker: Fist Rahir
AD_FlamingFist_003_InCombat.context: NodeContext: battle cry - determined and unafraid despite being outnumbered

AD_FlamingFist_001_CouncillorDefeated.speaker: Fist Thadwick

ArrivalInspector.speaker: Harper Arthus

FlamingFist_005.speaker: Fist Gretta
FlamingFist_005.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: solemn

session_synopses.AD_LoverInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.AD_ArguingWithFlorrick: Florrick and Vidor are talking between themselves about how to proceed. Florrick wants to wait until Mart Cullagh is awake and can tell them more about the shadowcurse. Vidor wants to plan an attack on Moonrise Towers to rescue Grand Duke Ravengard. They aren't at cross purposes, but they don't agree on much.
session_synopses.AD_WulbrenInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlirtyTiefling: Lakrissa's dialogue after her reunion scene with alfira (or potentially this is her only scene if alfira is dead). Lakrissa is usually playful and flirty but she is a but more restrained here. Still smiling but more somber.
session_synopses.AD_SisterInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_001: Thadwick is a male dwarf and grumpy is his middle name. He's a bit rough and gruff and has little time for the player - an amateur in his eyes. He warms up to him slightly as we progress through the dialogue. This dialogue cover his major states in Haven.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_002: Flaming Fist Aubree is devoted to the Ravengard but also pragmatic. She's unafraid of asking for the player's help and is concerned for Ravengard. Does her best to look at things in a non-judgemental way.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_003: Flaming Fist Rahir is a stern solider who admires Duke Ravengard. He is tough and nonense.
session_synopses.Arrival: Standing on a dock, the Player's just arrived back in Haven after escaping Moonrise Towers with a boat of prisoners seeking sanctuary. A surprised Harper greets you and says he'll need to test the new arrivals.
session_synopses.AD_Gnome02Inspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_004: A mercenary with the Flaming Fist, stuck in Haven with the refugees and one too pleased about it.
session_synopses.AD_Gnome01Inspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.ArrivalInspector: The Harper Inspecter is either looking over a batch of prisoners who've just arrived in Moonrise or has just finished inspecting them and is walking away when the player intercepts him. A gruff and suspicious guard.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_005: One of the flaming fists in Haven. Resting after an expedition to SCL.

AD_MarcusDefeated.speaker: Isobel
AD_MarcusDefeated.context: NodeContext: hurt and betrayal in her voice. She had to kill a friend who turned traitor.

session_synopses.AD_MarcusDefeated: Marcus is defeated after having betrayed Isobel.

PAD_MeenlockReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_MeenlockReaction.context: NodeContext: a monster has appeared before you - [prn. Mean-lock]

PAD_MeenlockReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_MeenlockReaction.text: Their eyes are made for the dark - fire and light is our friend.
PAD_MeenlockReaction.context: NodeContext: a monster has appeared before you, trying to warn your fellow player

session_synopses.PAD_MeenlockReaction: This fight occurs in the basement of the last light inn. Meenlocks are clawed fey creatures. If the player passes a check they identify them and their most dangerous aspect, otherwise they simply reccognise  what the meenlocks are and realise they are sensitive to light (light spell or torch for instance). If they fail, they can make note of their sharp claws (for instance.)

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: |Greeting.|

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: |Isobel answer.|

session_synopses: Nightsong in the Inn after being saved from Shar Temple. Isobel suppose to be somewhere nearby.

AD_AngryBrother.speaker: Cal
AD_AngryBrother.text: Rolan's right - I should have done more, I should have saved you.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: ...There's another bottle of Arabellan Dry back there. Put it on the bar, then piss off and leave me alone.
Rolan.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at UmiNodeContext: Slurring slightly, a little bit drunk and irritable - talking to Ide, a tiefling child behind the bar

Rolan.speaker: Ide
Rolan.text: Jaheira said we should serve drinks, but that we shouldn't serve drunks.
Rolan.context: NodeContext: cheerful, playing the part of a bartender - it's a game to him and this is a line he's learned

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Jaheira didn't save your ragged little tail from the cultists - I did.
Rolan.context: NodeContext: venemous - bitter, addressed to Umi

Rolan.speaker: Player
Rolan.text: You saved the kid? Sounds like you deserve a drink.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Oh, it's you. I'd recognise that self-righteous tone anywhere.
Rolan.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after noticing them, and sneers at them

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: If you're here to save the day again, you're a little late this time.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Oh, sod off. I'm only here because you 'helped' me and my family.
Rolan.context: NodeContext: Heavy sarcasm on 'helped' - not quite doing airquotes but that's the tone

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: I was ready to cut and run back at the grove, but you had other ideas.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Cal and Lia were taken in by your crap. You convinced them to play hero, and now they're gone.

Rolan.speaker: Player
Rolan.text: Do you know where they are?

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Dead for all I know. Or in the cult's tower with the others who were taken.

Rolan.speaker: Player
Rolan.text: They're better off dead than in the cult's hands.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Bullshit. If they're alive, I can save them.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: You go save the world, or your own arse, or whatever it is you do. I'll fix this.
Rolan.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away, back to the bar when he's done talking

Hologram.text: Lia, Cal, if you see this... I'm dead. It's nothing to get upset about - it's simply the way life is.
Hologram.context: NodeContext: voice thick with emotion at the thought of never seeing his siblings again, but he's trying to be no nonsense. Doesn't want them to grieve.

Hologram.text: Head to Baldur's Gate immediately. You'll both do excellently there, I have no doubt. And thank you for, well, you know.
Hologram.context: NodeContext: voice thick with emotion at the thought of never seeing his siblings again, but he's trying to be no nonsense. Doesn't want them to grieve.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: If this is about Rolan, go away.
Ide.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking away from player, avoiding eye contactNodeContext: Upset frustrated

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: No need to snap at me.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: ...Sorry. Rolan snapped too and I didn't like it.

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: Rolan isn't very good with kids.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: He isn't very good with anyone. He yelled at me just because I told him not to drink anymore.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: It was for his own good! He can barely stand up straight.
Ide.context: NodeContext: your voice could be mistake for petulance but you're just hurt and frustrated.

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: I get it - you were trying to look after him.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Yeah. He did save us, after all.
Ide.context: NodeContext: Kind of awkward and bashful about it

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: What do you mean, his loss?

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: I found this book. Old, dusty, full of strange lettering. Pretty sure it's magic.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: I was gonna give it to Rolan so he could learn new spells, you know? Beats drinking 'til he forgets the ones he knows.
Ide.context: NodeContext: a little downcast - you were trying to make a gesture and you feel it's been trodden on

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: Give it to me, you brat. Now.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Sorry. I didn't mean - here. Just go away!
Ide.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reach behind back for item from inventory - hands book to playerNodeContext: Tense afraid.

AD_BeforeReunion.speaker: Lia
AD_BeforeReunion.text: Gods, you smell like a brewery.

AD_BeforeReunion.speaker: Rolan
AD_BeforeReunion.text: What does that have to do with anything?
AD_BeforeReunion.context: NodeContext: pissed off, doesn't like anyone being worried about him

AD_BeforeReunion.speaker: Lia
AD_BeforeReunion.text: You're enough of an arse when you're sober, never mind drunk.
AD_BeforeReunion.context: NodeContext: knows she's adding fuel to the fire but is too mad not to

AD_BeforeReunion.speaker: Rolan
AD_BeforeReunion.text: Oh, don't get all high and mighty with me, Lia.

AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.speaker: Cal
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.text: How am I going to tell him about Lia?
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.context: NodeContext: grieving, wondering how rolan will react

AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.speaker: Cal
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.text: 'We escaped Moonrise, but things went wrong?'
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.context: NodeContext: trying to practice what to say to rolan, awkward and hesitant

AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.speaker: Cal
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.text: 'Lia didn't make it...' Gods, it doesn't sound real.
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.context: NodeContext: grief that his sister is dead hitting him

AD_SiblingsReturn.speaker: Cal
AD_SiblingsReturn.context: NodeContext: relief as he sees his siblings just ahead of him

AD_SiblingsReturn.speaker: Rolan
AD_SiblingsReturn.text: Cal! Wretched gods, where have you been? Where's Lia?

AD_SiblingsReturn.speaker: Rolan
AD_SiblingsReturn.text: Cal, answer me. Where is Lia?
AD_SiblingsReturn.context: NodeContext: worried and concern. sees the look on siblings face andfears the worst

AD_RolanAndKid.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanAndKid.text: Your job is to serve drinks, you little devil. Do it.
AD_RolanAndKid.context: NodeContext: absolutely hammered drunk and belligerent

AD_RolanAndKid.speaker: Umi
AD_RolanAndKid.context: NodeContext: small voice, trying to stand up to an adult

AD_RolanAndKid.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanAndKid.context: NodeContext: absolutely hammered drunk and belligerent, LOUD

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: Now that I'm here, that I'm safe, it's finally sinking in.
Sister.context: NodeContext: voice distant, barely processing the news

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.context: NodeContext: fists curling, quietly angry in her grief

Sister.speaker: Player
Sister.text: He died as he lived - stupidly.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: You and everyone in this dump can rot for all I damn care. And you will.
Sister.context: NodeContext: player has been cruel about rolan's death and lia is lashing out in her fury

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: Just pray we never meet again - you slimy sack of shit.
Sister.context: NodeContext: player has been cruel about rolan's death and lia is lashing out in her fury

AD_RolanReturns.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanReturns.context: NodeContext: exuberant - just returned from a dark place to find your sister Lia, having thought she was lost

AD_RolanReturns.speaker: Lia
AD_RolanReturns.text: You arsehole, where have you been?
AD_RolanReturns.context: NodeContext: sounds annoyed but actually just relieved

AD_RolanReturns.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanReturns.text: Never mind me - where is Cal?
AD_RolanReturns.context: NodeContext: Talking about your brother, who you haven't seen in some time - you're about to find out he's dead

AD_RolanReturns.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanReturns.text: Lia - answer me. Where is Cal?
AD_RolanReturns.context: NodeContext: sees sister''s face and fears the worst. Accusatory in worry

PAD_HologramReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_HologramReaction.text: He'll need help to survive those shadows. Only a fool would face them alone.

session_synopses.AD_AngryBrother: Lia died in Moonrise. Upon his return to Last Light, Cal and Rolan had a massive argument that the player failed to dispel. Cal, upset, walked away from Rolan and now stands on the balcony. He's upset, grieving, and wishing he had died instead of his sister.
session_synopses.Rolan: Rolan is an apprentice wizard whose siblings were recently captured by cultists. He's stuck in a tavern in the middle of the cursed lands where they were taken, drinking heavily, blaming himself for their loss. When he sees the players, he turns his frustration onto them - he's only here because they convinced him to stay with the other tieflings who were captured in the first place.Rolan is in fact the only reason any of the tieflings are still alive, having protected them from the traitorous Zevlor, who planned to give them over to the cult. He doesn't feel like a hero though - he feels like a failure.
session_synopses.Hologram: Rolan has left a message behind in Haven, for his siblings. This is a small automated hologram that is fixed to the bar counter. It plays a message (that he's gone looking for his siblings or that he's dead) when the player interacts with it.
session_synopses.Ide: Ide mainly talks about the interaction the player can have with Rolan in his dialog (HAV_ProdigyLament_Rolan), where he berates the kid for not giving him more alcohol. This dialog continues that narrative beat, and players can acquire a book Ide was planning to give Rolan.
session_synopses.AD_BeforeReunion: This AD covers the following scenarios: Lia alive, Cal dead. Cal alive, Lia dead. Cal, Lia and Rolan all alive and well. This AD occurs after the player has rescued Cal and/ or Lia from Moonrise towers, but BEFORE the player triggers the reunion scene in Last Light. The siblings are standing together and arguing.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherWaitingAlone: Cal has been rescued from Moonrise towers prison by the player and is now in Last Light Inn. His sister Lia is dead and his brother Rolan is nowhere to be found (but he left a message telling Cal to wait for his return). Cal is talking to himself here. He's nervous, scared for Rolan and grieving Lia.
session_synopses.AD_SiblingsReturn: A one off AD that occurs when Lia and/or Cal spot Rolan upon entering Last Light after being rescued from Moonrise.
session_synopses.AD_RolanAndKid: Roland and Umi are standing at the bar. Umi is behind the bar and Roland is badgering Umi to serve him more alcohol. Roland is extremely drunk and belligerent, and Umi is trying to calm him down.
session_synopses.Sister: Lia has been rescued from Moonrise Towers by the player and is now in Last Light. This dialogue covers multiple states: Rolan is missing, Rolan is dead, Rolan and Lia had a fight (player must pass a persuade to calm the fight, pass and fail states here), and a general state for when cal, lia and rolan are all alive and well and Lia is grateful to the player.
session_synopses.AD_RolanReturns: A one off AD that triggers when the siblings return and spot each other in haven. In this version cal and/or lia are waiting in Last light when rolan returns.
session_synopses.PAD_HologramReaction: PAD for after players see Rolan's hologram in the Last Light Inn for the first time. They comment on needing to go save Rolan as he won't be able to shadow creatures on his own.

node_data.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
node_data.text: | Thank you for rescuing me. |

node_data.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
node_data.text: | Once we are in Baldur's Gate, you will be rewarded. |

PAD_SpottedWrit.speaker: Player
PAD_SpottedWrit.text: What's that sticking out of his pocket?

node_data.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
node_data.text: Please, if you have any idea how to get through to him...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Gently pleading.

node_data.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
node_data.text: If you know how to get through to him, don't hesitate.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It may be some kind of magical affliction...
False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You can't determine the nature of his ailment.*

node_data.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
node_data.text: If you know how to get through to him, don't hesitate.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Pull out the lute you found and play a little.
CinematicNodeContext: Player strums the lute
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player strums the lute

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: Thaniel! He's still trapped there - he needs help!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: He bolts upright at the sound of the lute. Player puts the lute down on the ground.NodeContext: <GL> rerecord with a sudden snap to awake, He is panicked about Thaniel. Old read was too gradual.
sits bolt upright in bed, shocked and afraid - breathless

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: My lute. You got it back. How?
node_data.context: NodeContext: gathering himself mentally, shocked and almost disbelieving

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I killed Malus Thorm, a twisted surgeon, and took it from his corpse.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: You killed a Thorm? They're Ketheric's elite, how did you - never mind. He needs us, needs our help.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: I've been lost in the shadows so long. And I met a boy there too - Thaniel. He's the only reason my mind survived that emptiness, that... loss.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: He told me about someone he knew. Someone called 'Halsin' -  a druid. Thaniel spoke of little else.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: Do you know him?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Who is this Halsin?

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: He's an expert on the curse. He was here when it all began, Thaniel said.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: Thaniel is more than a boy, you see. He's the spirit of the land. Without the druid, without Halsin, Thaniel is trapped - and the curse cannot be lifted.

session_synopses.PAD_SpottedWrit: Observation on spotting the writ in Art Cullagh's pants. This is needed to direct the player to the House of Healing, which is where they will find his lute.
session_synopses: The player tries to talk to a cursed Flaming Fist, who is currently unable to talk. Fist J'ehlar is presently trying to do the same thing, and responds to the player while trying to keep Cullagh in the loop, i.e. doesn't want to talk over his head and tries to include him in the convo.If the player retrieves his Art's dulcimer and plays it, Cullagh can start to come around and wake up.

Gnome001.speaker: Nimble
Gnome001.text: I suppose this place will do for now. Better than a cell in the Towers, at the very least.
Gnome001.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Not Met.NodeContext: Arrogance; player has saved him and brought him here.

Gnome001.speaker: Nimble
Gnome001.text: I'd thank you for your help, but I doubt you need to hear such trivialities. So I'll just say fare-thee-well.

session_synopses.Gnome001: This gnome was saved from Moonrise Jail by the players.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: You actually did it - you rescued them from Moonrise. How?
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: full of gratitude

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: By doing what I do best - being a hero.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: If it was anyone else, I'd be sceptical - but you? You've more than earned the title of hero.
Bard.context: NodeContext: grateful and a little flirty

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: By the time we get to the city, I'm gonna have an entire catalogue of songs about you.
Bard.context: NodeContext: grateful and a little flirty

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: It's not much, but here - you deserve it.

AD_WithFlirty.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_WithFlirty.text: Anything happen while I was away?
AD_WithFlirty.context: NodeContext: trying to make convo but she's actually worried for alfira

AD_WithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
AD_WithFlirty.text: Too much. I can't wait for things to just be... quiet.
AD_WithFlirty.context: NodeContext: little bit tired and down but trying not to sound it.

AD_WithFlirty.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_WithFlirty.text: It'll be quiet in the city. We'll have a little house, maybe a garden?
AD_WithFlirty.context: NodeContext: sincere and heartfelt - trying to make alfira smile

session_synopses.Bard: Alfira has seen her friends, people she considered family, dragged screaming into the nigh. She is upset and only just holding it together. She asks the player to save the prisoners in Moonrise.
session_synopses.AD_WithFlirty: This occurs after alfira and lakrissa have their reunion scene in last light (player has rescued lakrissa from moonrise). Lakrissa and Alfira are being cute and concenered for each other.

002.speaker: Harper Bor
002.context: NodeContext: nervous, but hope is returning

session_synopses.002: Bor is a grizzled Harper veteran who treats all twists of fate with the same cheerful resignation.

AD_HalsinCombat.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinCombat.text: It's ready - I'm going through. May the Oak Father guide me back to you.
AD_HalsinCombat.context: NodeContext: Urgent shout to the player. He's ready to enter the portal he's opened.

session_synopses.AD_HalsinCombat: ADs from Halsin while he's conducting the ritual to open a portal to the Shadowfell while the player fights off shadows. Once he's ready, he departs via the portal.

Mirkon.speaker: Mirkon
Mirkon.text: Once Ketheric is gone, we can get out of here. I can't wait.
Mirkon.context: InternalNodeContext: Nightsong arrived to Haven/dead, people know that Ketheric can be killedNodeContext: This is the first bit of hope you've felt in a while. Thinking of the outside and travelling without fear

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.text: Yeah, 'cause she did a great job protecting Mol.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.speaker: Mattis
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.text: Maybe we should ask someone else?
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.context: NodeContext: kind of coming around to umi's thinking

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.text: Who? No one cares - no one but us.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.context: NodeContext: determined - feeling like she's on her own

session_synopses.AD_Mattis: AD for Mattis, a cheeky Dodger type character selling trinkets in the Last Light Inn. Mattis is shouting out, trying to draw customers in.
session_synopses.Mirkon: Mirkon is the boy who survived the Harpies trying to lull him into the water in the grove. He is a timid boy who does his best to be brave, and dreams of being an adventurer one day. This is his dialogue in Haven, which covers the main states of the kidnapping, losing Isobel, reporting that his fellow tieflings died, when the player returns them and so on.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerFoundTreasure_MirkonsComment: AD which Mirkon says if he sees the player finding a treasure which is hidden behind a wall. Excited and child-like.
session_synopses.KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD: Umi, Mattis and Ide are discussing a plan to rescue their friend Mol from Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: I promised you a drink the next time we met. This inn isn't what I had in mind.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Smiling, happy to see us, but muted. She's suffered tragedy since we last saw her.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: I owe you an apology. You pulled my people from one death-trap, only for me to land them in another.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Growing serious - in her mind, she messed up the chance we gave her

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: How did you blunder into danger this time?

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: ...I suppose I deserve that.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little stiff - primed to take offense but relaxes, accepts the insult is probably warranted

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: I was trying to scout a path for us while you got busy carving one. But don't worry, I've had my fill of fighting since.
node_data.context: NodeContext: wry, but ending on a somber note

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: Aye, and more than half the others with him.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: We were ambushed out in the cursed lands - cultists of this Absolute. Likely we should have surrendered, but...

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: They were toying with us. Making examples. And we'd had enough of taking it.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: Those of us who cut free just kept running 'til we found this place. The others... maybe the cult got them. Maybe the curse.
