node_data.context: NodeContext: The player is about to attack someone that's probably going to absolutely crush them, and we're reminding them it might not be a great idea

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Attack!

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: You blasphemous little wretch!
node_data.context: NodeContext: furious, directed at player

node_data.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
node_data.text: How amusing. Take care of them, Z'rell.

Guard_006.speaker: Zealot Rylveth
Guard_006.text: I swore myself to Lolth for years. But she never let me sack a city.
Guard_006.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Looking forward to the fight to come

Guard_001.speaker: Adept Mola
Guard_001.text: The General's advisor is back. Anyone left in the cells better start praying.
Guard_001.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.NodeContext: Almost pities the  prisoners - the man he speaks of loves toying with prisoners

AD_FezzerkPlea.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_FezzerkPlea.text: I don't know nothing about any of this.

CombatInterruption.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption.text: What is your name, True Soul?

CombatInterruption.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption.text: I suppose it doesn't. Z'rell: Kill this fool.
CombatInterruption.context: NodeContext: Maybe a bit of comedy here. 'Funny' (stern). 'And sad' (mockery). 'Zrel: kill him' (dead seriousness)

session_synopses.AD_MintharaPlea: Minthara is pleading for her life before Ketheric at the MOO Execution scene.These are played as interjections after Ketheric finishes his own AD.
session_synopses.Guard_003: Female Human. Guard and Absolute cultist.
session_synopses.Guard_002: Male Drow. Guard and Absolute cultist.
session_synopses.Guard_005: Female Human. Guard and Absolute cultist. Magic user.
session_synopses: When we arrive in Moonrise towers, we almost immediately stumble upon a drow True Soul executing three goblins. Critpath.
session_synopses.Guard_006: Female Drow. Guard and Absolute cultist.
session_synopses.Guard_001: Female Half-orc guard, a magic user and Absolute cultist.
session_synopses.AD_FezzerkPlea: Goblins are pleading for their lives before Ketheric at the MOO Execution scene.These are played as interjections after Ketheric finishes his own AD.
session_synopses.CombatInterruption: Ketheric leaves after delegating Z'rell to deal with the players.

PAD_Entry.speaker: Player
PAD_Entry.text: Every bit as disgusting as the first time.

PAD_Escape.speaker: Player
PAD_Escape.text: The stink of that place might never wash out.

session_synopses.PAD_Entry: A PAD reacting to arriving in the bloodbath section of the Oubliette. This will also trigger a second time if the player leaves the Oubliette area and re-enters the bloodbath section.
session_synopses.CorpseMembranes_Dead: The Speak With Dead dialog for the corpse hidden behind the mind flayer membranes in the bloodbath section of the Oubliette. This corpse is currently a goblin, but its race and backstory can be changed at the writer's behest.
session_synopses.PAD_Escape: A PAD of the players reacting to escaping the Oubliette after having been in the bloodbath section, where they literally waded through blood and human remains. The players climb up the cliff face and arrive in the cavern adjacent to the prison.

AD_BackToWork.speaker: Linsella
AD_BackToWork.text: You boys are very good with those cleavers. Something tells me you've had the practice, hm?

GnollMaster.speaker: Linsella
GnollMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mid-conversation with a gnoll, holds up hand to us as we approach

GnollMaster.speaker: Linsella
GnollMaster.text: You use a spoon to stir the soup, Barnabus. Forget the axe, my darling.
GnollMaster.context: NodeContext: Kindly - speaking to a favourite child that is none too bright

GnollMaster.speaker: 'Barnabus'
GnollMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gnoll tilts its head and nods.NodeContext: Gnolls make hyena noises - this is a soft sound of acknowledgement/comprehension. Tilting its head and nodding.

GnollMaster.speaker: Linsella
GnollMaster.text: Now! How can I help you?
GnollMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns back to usNodeContext: Chipper, friendly

session_synopses.AD_BackToWork: The kitchen master is calling affectionate instructions to her scullions - a pack of half-tamed gnolls. Tone is sing-song and sweet.
session_synopses.GnollMaster: A True Soul oversees some gnolls in the kitchen. They're uncharacteristically quiet, and she explains that the Absolute has given her the ability to 'bring out the good' in then. In truth she is simply dominating them - she'll demonstrate by forcing the gnoll to perform tricks, but we can subvert her power and let the gnoll kill her.

AD_Execution.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution.text: Considering all that is at stake...

AD_Execution.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution.text: Considering how close we are to the conclusion of our efforts...

AD_Execution.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution.text: I ask you again: why am I here?
AD_Execution.context: NodeContext: Bitter vitriol in his voice.

session_synopses.AD_Execution: Ketheric's AD before the execution. Bitter vitriol in his voice.

Guard01.speaker: Acolyte Kimmeral
Guard01.text: Don't mind Mig and her 'meat sounds'. It's just her brain slopping around in her skull.
Guard01.context: NodeContext: Mig is an ogre complaining about 'meat sounds' - you are reluctantly sharing a room with the ogre, and explaining his weirdness away

Guard02.speaker: Zealot Iogar
Guard02.text: You'd find better lodgings out in the war camp, True Soul.

Guard02.speaker: Zealot Iogar
Guard02.text: I know we're all one under the Absolute, but you do not want to bunk with an ogre.
Guard02.context: NodeContext: Emphatic - this guard has seen things

session_synopses.Guard01: A guard stationed alongside Mig the ogre. Mig is complaining of hearing "meat sounds" - in actuality it's a monster moving through the walls. This guard doesn't believe him either way.
session_synopses.Guard02: A guard in the guard room of Moonrise Tower. They're growing accustomed to living and fighting alongside monstrous races.

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithGuard001.context: NodeContext: A terse religious greeting - a better to an underling, annoyed to be speaking to a lower rank

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_WithGuard001.text: There are some ghouls nesting on the upper ramparts. They seem... restless.

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithGuard001.text: We had best hope they don't forget themselves - or I'll have to send you out there to calm them down.

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_WithGuard001.text: I'll put some sense in their heads, Disciple.

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithGuard001.text: Or some meat in their bellies, at least.

FlamingSpy.speaker: Fist Marcus
FlamingSpy.text: My unexpected ally! The General was very pleased with Isobel's return. Don't worry, I told him all about you.
FlamingSpy.context: NodeContext: genuine in the first line, but in the second he sounds smug (he totally took all the credit)

Ogre.speaker: Glourik
Ogre.context: NodeContext: Finger wagging, chiding like a child

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_WithSpy.text: I am free to do more for the Absolute, Disciple. Anything.
AD_WithSpy.context: NodeContext: A terse religious greeting - a better to an underling, annoyed to be speaking to a lower rank

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithSpy.text: Would you cast yourself from the tower-top?

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_WithSpy.text: Of course. I have the Absolute's wings to catch me.

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithSpy.text: Off you go, then. I've always wanted to try those ballistas.

session_synopses.AD_WithGuard001: A patrolling guard stops and reports to Z'rell.
session_synopses.FlamingSpy: Marcus is in Moonrise after either kidnapping isobel OR being thwarted by the player.
session_synopses.Ogre: For the lumbering threat that stands beside the door to the Duke Double scene.
session_synopses.AD_WithSpy: Z'rell and Marcus are talking after Marcus has kidnapped Isobel.

000_AD_CombatStarts.speaker: Harper Lassandra
000_AD_CombatStarts.text: That's them! Kill the drider - take the Moonlantern!

000_AD_DriderDropsLantern.speaker: Harper Lassandra
000_AD_DriderDropsLantern.text: The lantern's down - we need to get it!

000_AD_DriderDies.speaker: Harper Lassandra
000_AD_DriderDies.text: Got him! Now to get the lantern.

session_synopses.000_AD_CombatStarts: Start ambush combat with Harper Lassandra present
session_synopses.000_AD_DriderDropsLantern: Drider drops lantern (either being disarmed or killed)
session_synopses.000_AD_DriderDies: Drider dies with Harper Lassandra present

PAD_InvestigatedOx.speaker: Player
PAD_InvestigatedOx.text: Hells. Poor thing didn't deserve to die like this.
PAD_InvestigatedOx.context: NodeContext: Commenting on a dead ox at the site of an ambushed refugee caravan

PAD_InvestigatedTiefling.speaker: Player
PAD_InvestigatedTiefling.text: Gored to death, by the look of it.
PAD_InvestigatedTiefling.context: NodeContext: Commenting on a tiefling who was gored to death

session_synopses.PAD_InvestigatedOx: Player discovers the dead ox that was part of the tiefling refugee caravan. The ox became shadowcursed before being killed by the tieflings. The player rolls an Investigation check to understand the circumstances of the ox's death
session_synopses.PAD_InvestigatedTiefling: The player finds a dead tiefling near the refugee's abandoned caravan. The tiefling was killed by the shadowcursed ox. The player rolls a Medicine check to determine the tiefling's death

VB_DirtpileGas.speaker: Player
VB_DirtpileGas.text: Argh! This air is foul with rot. Better be careful...

AD_MountainPassSignpost.speaker: Narrator
AD_MountainPassSignpost.text: *Chionthar Mountain Pass - East. Reithwin and Moonrise Towers - West.*

PAD_HalsinBridge.speaker: Halsin
PAD_HalsinBridge.text: This town - I remember it too well. Much druid and Harper blood was spilled in taking it... only to lose it again.

session_synopses.AD_MountainPassSignpost: AD on signpost in the shadow cursed lands. The road is twisted and broken, the sign is leaning at an odd angle, but you can still read that Moonrise is ahead on the West. If you will follow the road you will eventually hit the Town and Moonrise.
session_synopses.PAD_HalsinBridge: Halsin remembers his previous battle in SCL

ShadowMemory4.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory4.text: *You sense a fading echo of the person who once was. A dockhand. He did not ask for this.*

ShadowMemory20.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory20.text: *A distant memory of a man stretching his back with a groan. Another day of hauling masonry blocks done...*

ShadowMemory8.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory8.text: *She was a healer, trying to aid the wounded in the battle against the Sharrans. But there were so many...*

ShadowMemory16.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory16.text: *You sense a matriarch's flush of pride - she will soon be a grandmother, and the child will bear her name. Muldred.*

Entrance_Plaque3.speaker: Narrator
Entrance_Plaque3.text: *We offer ourselves to the darkness, that blessed Shar may give us her mercy.*

ShadowMemory17.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory17.text: *Callused hands work a hammer and chisel around a massive slab of rock. Months from now, a face will take shape.*

ShadowMemory9.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory9.text: *You see a man stalking slowly through the woods, bow half-drawn. If he bags a deer, the whole family will be kept fed all winter...*

ShadowMemory21.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory21.text: *You can almost taste the sour ale that once clung to this soul's breath. He was insensible when the shadows came for him.*

ShadowMemory5.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory5.text: *You glimpse a young Harper on the eve of battle against Thorm, long ago. He and his comrades toast each other in Last Light...*

ShadowMemory10.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory10.text: *In her former life, this girl played in the nearby woods. She was always the best at climbing trees.*

ShadowMemory2.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory2.text: *You can almost feel the heat from the forge. This one was once a blacksmith.*

ShadowMemory26.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory26.text: *You sense a faded memory of marching in an army against Ketheric Thorm. Victory seemed possible then.*

ShadowMemory30.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory30.text: *An echo of the past shows a man hunched over a ledger, quill in hand. Tolls collected on the Risen Road, destined for Moonrise.*

ShadowMemory31.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory31.text: *You see a man drain his tankard in an inn as he listens to a Flaming Fist play the lute. He's better than his uniform might suggest.*

ShadowMemory27.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory27.text: *You can almost smell the hops and barley for yourself. This man's family always complained that his clothing reeked after work at the brewery.*

ShadowMemory3.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory3.text: *Desperate prayers to Selûne, echoing from the past. They did not save him.*

ShadowMemory11.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory11.text: *You see an older woman, on her knees, scrubbing the floor of an inn. The patrons made a mess of things again the night before.*

ShadowMemory28.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory28.text: *You hear the heavy thud of a butcher's cleaver on his block, as he divides his meagre fare for those waiting. Never enough to go around.*

ShadowMemory12.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory12.text: *He had dreams of boarding a ship in Baldur's Gate, and seeing the world. But then the darkness came.*

ShadowMemory32.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory32.text: *An older man turns his head away in shame. His neighbours would not renounce Selûne - now they hang in the town square.*

ShadowMemory24.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory24.text: *A strange feeling of resentment comes to you. A travelling merchant, sick of this route. Sick of the tolls eating away his profits.*

ShadowMemory1.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory1.text: *A faded memory of a boy and girl sharing their first kiss. Your own heart almost flutters in tune with theirs.*

ShadowMemory25.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory25.text: *You see an old boot, balanced upside down on a cobbler's knee, as he taps the final nail into the new sole. Good as new.*

ShadowMemory33.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory33.text: *You feel a rush of outrage. This woman worshipped Shar to the end - so why does the Nightsinger's curse not spare her...?*

ShadowMemory29.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory29.text: *You see a mother sitting by her child's bedside, listening to his sickly breathing as he sleeps.*

ShadowMemory6.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory6.text: *Thoughts of baby names. She did not wish for her first born to be named after her mother-in-law. Muldred. Ugh.*

ShadowMemory18.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory18.text: *You sense this one hid for days as the sounds of battle got closer and closer to town. You didn't even care who won, so long as it ended.*

ShadowMemory15.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory15.text: *You sense a swell of grief. Before the shadows took her, this woman mourned someone lost in battle.*

ShadowMemory7.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory7.text: *You sense that this one was once a fisherman, taught by his father.*

Entrance_Plaque2.speaker: Narrator
Entrance_Plaque2.text: *We offer our pain to the Lady of Loss, that she may truly know her faithful.*

session_synopses.ShadowMemory4: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.

session_synopses.Entrance_Plaque2: rounded clickable plaque in the exit/enrance to the Underdark right next to the Elevator

AD_LostGoods.speaker: Narrator
AD_LostGoods.text: *A pile of belongings, forsaken to the curse so that their owners could escape with their lives.*

AD_EmeraldEnclaveFallen.speaker: Narrator
AD_EmeraldEnclaveFallen.text: *Fallen members of the Emerald Enclave. Casualties in the war against Ketheric Thorm, years past.*

session_synopses.AD_LostGoods: Lost goods and piles of valuables - sacks, chests, boxes, backpacks left behind by people dashing out to save their lives.
session_synopses.AD_EmeraldEnclaveFallen: There are number of pile of fallen withered skeletons in greenish armors of Emerald Enclave.They are remains from the past war with Ketheric and his Justiciars

PAD_WantsOintment.speaker: Player
PAD_WantsOintment.text: Here we go - if there's any of that ointment left, I could use it.

PAD_WantsOintment.speaker: Player
PAD_WantsOintment.text: Same here. I don't want to face whatever's out there unprotected.

PAD_ShadowheartResistant.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartResistant.text: I can feel the shadows' power here... but they don't seem to be harming me?
PAD_ShadowheartResistant.context: NodeContext: Some confusion. She seems to have resistance in a shadow-cursed environment  that's affecting all others.

PAD_LightsSnuffedOut.speaker: Player
PAD_LightsSnuffedOut.text: Hells. Torchlight won't last long here.

PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.text: The Dark Lady shields me - I can feel her.
PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.context: NodeContext: Commenting on having divine protection from a shadow curse that affects all others

session_synopses.PAD_WantsOintment: PAD where a character who doesn't have the ointment applied steps into the shadowcurse and considers applying some. Only triggers if someone has spare ointment in their inventory. (At least one application)Plays only if 2 or more characters present: first to speak doesn't have the ointment applied on them. SH speaks first if she can.WRITER, don't forget to update the voicebark file SCL_ShadowCurse_VB_WantsOintment if you change the structure here!
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartResistant: Shadowheart comments on how she is resistant to the first layer of the curse.
session_synopses.PAD_LightsSnuffedOut: You're walking through an area where the shadow curse is strong and your torch gets snuffed out by the curse.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBlessed: Shadowheart comments on feeling Shar's protection against the curse return.

session_synopses.AD_BeforeTown: Signpost between last light and town

PAD_HideAndSeek.speaker: Player
PAD_HideAndSeek.text: Where'd that child go? Or... whatever it is.
PAD_HideAndSeek.context: NodeContext: Stumped, looking for Oliver Found Oliver (a little shadow/phantom boy they're playing hide and seek with)

AD_CreepyNoises001.speaker: Object
AD_CreepyNoises001.text: She was no fun. All I wanted was to play.
AD_CreepyNoises001.context: NodeContext: Disappointed. Referring to a dead githyanki the player comes across.

OliverShadow.speaker: Oliver
OliverShadow.text: You weren't supposed to find me. You weren't supposed to win.
OliverShadow.context: NodeContext: More confused than angry, like the impossible has happened.

OliverShadow.speaker: Oliver
OliverShadow.text: You're not my mummy or my daddy - don't tell me what to do.

OliverShadow.speaker: Oliver
OliverShadow.text: Let's play another game - I deserve a chance to even the score.

OliverShadow.speaker: Oliver
OliverShadow.text: Try to find me again - but my family will be looking for you at the same time, so don't get caught!

session_synopses.PAD_HideAndSeek: AD played when the player finds or fails to find Oliver during hide & seek.
session_synopses.AD_CreepyNoises001: The player hears creepy noises on the path to the house haunted by a shadow family.
session_synopses.OliverShadow: Dialog with Oliver, the shadow-child in the Shadowcursed Lands. Oliver wishes for the player to be his playmate, and engages in a game of hide and seek. Oliver seems to be a soul trapped by the curse for a 100 years, but the player will gradually realise over the course of the act that he is in fact a shadow version of Thaniel, the spirit of the land. Oliver possesses Thaniel's heart, and the curse cannot be lifted until it is returned. Oliver does not want to do this - he's made his own little 'family' using cursed beings in the area. If the player challenges him about Thaniel, Oliver will flee towards the town square, where a final confrontation will take place.

AD_HalfOrcs_AtTower.speaker: Bedi
AD_HalfOrcs_AtTower.text: I wonder what this place looked like in its glory.

AD_HalfOrcs_AtTower.speaker: Bedi
AD_HalfOrcs_AtTower.text: Still. I bet Ketheric changed his wall hangings as often as his gods.

AD_HalfOrcs_AtTower.speaker: Kansif
AD_HalfOrcs_AtTower.text: Careful. The General has excellent hearing, I'm told.

session_synopses.AD_HalfOrcs_AtTower: Half orcs after arriving at Moonrise Towers with the Drider's caravan. Kansif is the solemn leaderm, the other half orc is a relatively new recruit and doesn't guard his tongue too well.

AD_Sign.speaker: Narrator
AD_Sign.text:
*North - Last Light Inn
South - Risen Road
West - Reithwin Town*

session_synopses.AD_Sign: Signpost between the Risen Road and Last Light, also points across a chasm towards the town

PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale.speaker: Player
PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale.text: That's odd. The flame won't go out.

PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale.speaker: Player
PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale.text: Ah - a Continual Flame. Nothing can douse it, near as I can tell.

session_synopses.PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale: Party remarks on torches they cannot extinguish.

PAD_Approach.speaker: Player
PAD_Approach.text: A dead bird. What happened to it?
PAD_Approach.context: NodeContext: Reacting to coming across a dead bird in the shadow-cursed lands.

session_synopses.PAD_Approach: A player encounters a dead bird.

PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.text: Dark Justiciars fell here. Those signs we saw before were no coincidence - they led us here.
PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.context: NodeContext: Captivated. Arc: SH is loyal to shar. Starting to vocalise a sneaking suspicion that this temple is a legendary Sharran site, before dismissing the thought.

session_synopses.PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains: Shadowheart finds the remains of the Dark Justiciars and based on her level of knowledge will make a comment. All of them meant to build up anticipation for the Shar Temple. Can be triggered multiple times.

session_synopses.AD: ADs for the hyena at the SCL entrance where the goblins are camping.

session_synopses.DeadHarper: The player uses Speak with Dead to talk to a dead Harper in the Shadowcursed Lands. The Harper was sent by Jaheira to find weaknesses in Ketheric's Defense. The Harper player should be able to earn some redundant information that can be learned elsewhere as well as some unique information to help them navigate Act 2

PAD_DeadDruids.speaker: Player
PAD_DeadDruids.text: There was a battle here once - a large one.

session_synopses.PAD_DeadDruids: Party comments on the remains of the battle with Ketheric from 100 years ago.Halsin in particular comments on how the forces from the Emerald Grove were here.

PAD_DiscoverBurrow.speaker: Player
PAD_DiscoverBurrow.text: Something's buried in the dirt. Is that a femur?

AD_ReadTombstone.speaker: Narrator
AD_ReadTombstone.text: *'Ellie May'? You've seen this name before.*
AD_ReadTombstone.context: InternalNodeContext: Plays only the first time you interact with the grave after reading the robber's note, if you haven't found the ring yet.NodeContext: player has seen the name in a letter before

session_synopses.PAD_DiscoverBurrow: When the player discovers the burrow where the ring is hidden. An animal dug up the ring from the grave and hid it here.
session_synopses.AD_ReadTombstone: When the player reads the tombstone, they make out the name of the woman buried there. This is connected to the skeptical robber situation.

Memories.speaker: He Who Was
Memories.text: The air stirs in trepidation - you have the ledger.

Memories.speaker: He Who Was
Memories.text: We have it - her lies, her guilt. Madeline reported her friends to a Dark Justiciar and fled when they were butchered.
Memories.context: NodeContext: a touch of excitement begins to creep into the usually cold tone. Cruel smile.

Memories.speaker: He Who Was
Memories.text: Well, she flees no more. I will be the conduit for Madeline's spirit. I will force her to face trial.
Memories.context: NodeContext: a touch of excitement begins to creep into the usually cold tone. Cruel smile.

Memories.speaker: He Who Was
Memories.text: And you will be the judge. Make her beg, make her suffer.
Memories.context: NodeContext: a touch of excitement begins to creep into the usually cold tone. Cruel smile.

Memories.speaker: Player
Memories.text: When punishment is needed, my hand will not shy from the blade.

Memories.speaker: He Who Was
Memories.text: The raven was right, we were fated to meet. Break her, my friend - most thoroughly.
Memories.context: NodeContext: pleased the player agrees with him, thinks they are of one mind and both enjoy cruelty

Memories.speaker: He Who Was
Memories.text: What's this? The ledger is gone - how curious. Without it, the ceremony is an impossibility.
Memories.context: NodeContext: Patting down his 'pockets' like he's looking for something. Irritated. 'how curious' glares at player with a clear accusation (the player stole the ledger)

Memories.speaker: He Who Was
Memories.text: A pity. Should I find another murderer in need of torment, I will find you. Until then, farewell.

AD_Idle.speaker: Raven
AD_Idle.context: NodeContext: this is a raven mimicking human speech (look it up on youtube, it's cool and freaky!). Emotionaless and freaky. A loud bark.

AD_Idle.speaker: He Who Was
AD_Idle.text: No. Not until we've dealt with Madeline.

AD_TakingTurn_003_Combat.speaker: He Who Was
AD_TakingTurn_003_Combat.text: You have been judged - and found wanting.

session_synopses.AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat: Combat ADs for the Shadar Kai. Says one line at the start orf each of his turns.
session_synopses.Memories: The player has delivered Madeline's ledger to He Who Was. The shadar-kai uses the book to channel her spirit. Player can punish her, making her stab herself the way her friends died, verbally admonish her, or forgive her.
session_synopses.AD_Idle: An idle AD playing from time to time after the ritual. This gives hints that He Who Was and the raven are not actually supposed to be in the shadowlands.
session_synopses.AD_TakingTurn_003_Combat: Combat ADs for the Shadar Kai. Says one line at the start orf each of his turns.

Harper_Melee_000_AD_DriderDies.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_DriderDies.text: Big and ugly's down - grab the lantern!

Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster.text: You will die here - the Absolute wills it so!

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: And what of the strange little turncoat, Majesty? Should we spare them?

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: *Your minds connect and you hear a whispered voice. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the dark?*

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: A True Soul. Why would one of our queen's blessed walk with Harpers?

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: I infiltrated their ranks - gathering information for our cause.

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: Very well. We welcome all who follow our holy queen.

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: Are they ready to depart? We do not want to linger in the shadows, Majesty.

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: Give me a moment, I'm not ready to go yet.

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: We will wait, but not for long.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.text: One less blight in the darkness. A thousand more to conquer.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.text: At very least. For every beast we slay, the shadows spawn two more.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.text: Gods - why so glum? We hit the cult where it hurts.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Skywin
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.text: A victory is a victory. Our heads are intact - and that's worth celebrating.

AD_HarpersReachAmbushHouse.text: Perfect spot for an ambush. Get into position.

Harper_Melee_000_AD_LassandraDies.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_LassandraDies.context: NodeContext: Just watched your friend Lassandra die in combat

Caravan_AD_Hyena.speaker: Hyena
Caravan_AD_Hyena.context: NodeContext: Worg pup - sounds like a growl, but actually haltingly articulating a word (they can speak)

Caravan_AD_Hyena.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_AD_Hyena.text: Don't make eyes at me, you breech-blossom.
Caravan_AD_Hyena.context: NodeContext: Colourful goblin equivalent of 'shit-stain'. Said indignantly.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: Heard you're planning to infiltrate Moonrise, and take the fight to Ketheric. That'd be a tale for the ages.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: But the curse is at its strongest between here and there. You won't even reach the tower unless you can survive the darkest shadows.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: There's a cultist convoy that brings supplies and personnel to the tower - by some strange magic, they move through the curse unharmed.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: With your help, we'll ambush them, and seize their secret. When we do, it's yours, and the path to Moonrise will be open.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Player
HarperCaster_000.text: Let's do it. You lead, I follow.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: You got it, chum. I'll mark your map, in case you get lost.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: But - try not to get lost. Frightful weather out there.
HarperCaster_000.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky. The cursed shadows could kill you!

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: Your worshippers, Majesty. What happened here?
CaravanStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider arrives to find the camp deserted apart from you and some dead goblins.InternalNodeContext: Drider arrives to find the camp has been slaughteredNodeContext: Looking around at dead goblins - his allies have been slaughtered

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns and looks at the player with malevolenceNodeContext: Turns and looks at the player with malevolence

CaravanStart.speaker: Player
CaravanStart.text: I just found them like this.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: At least these have survived. At least we return with some faithful.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: But we should depart. Are they ready to leave?
CaravanStart.context: NodeContext: Looks out to the dark, then back to players

CaravanStart.speaker: Lae'zel
CaravanStart.text: Every step into the darkness leads us away from the crèche. Cleansing awaits - do not lose sight of our prize.

CaravanStart.speaker: Player
CaravanStart.text: First tell me how you can move safely through the darkness.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: We walk in the Absolute's light. Her blessed power keeps the shadows back.
CaravanStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider stares at the moon lantern while delivering line.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: But the shadows are cunning. Wily. If you stray from the light even for a moment, they'll have you.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: Listen - if you want to reach Moonrise, you're going to need help. And I know where you'll find it.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: There's a cultist convoy that passes each day. It carries a lantern that burns the curse away.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: You're going to seize that lantern - and I'm going to help you. Just say the word.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: Go on ahead. I'll catch up.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: Sure, why not? I'll mark your map.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: But don't take long. We must strike while the iron is hot.

AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush.text: All right. You ready for this?

CINE_CaravanIntro.text: CinematicNodeContext: The player pauses as they hear nearby footfalls. They crouch down and observe.
CINE_CaravanIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player pauses as they hear nearby footfalls. They crouch down and observe.

CINE_CaravanIntro.speaker: Kar'niss
CINE_CaravanIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player observes as the drider caravan moves into frame (wide shot).NodeContext: Urging the caravan along.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts lantern and illuminates their face.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts lantern and illuminates their face.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in player's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Player stows the lantern.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: Jaheira's godsend. Such strange company you keep.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.NodeContext: Very suspicious

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: I meant to infiltrate the cult. You've ruined the mission.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: Your mission is fiction, snake - and Harpers do not ally with liars. We silence them.

WaitingDuringEscort.speaker: Kar'niss
WaitingDuringEscort.text: Do not stray from the light, little one. The shadows are hungry.
WaitingDuringEscort.context: NodeContext: panicking a little, twitchy. Stopped momentarily in a dangerous region

WaitingDuringEscort.speaker: Kar'niss
WaitingDuringEscort.text: I do not lead. I follow Her voice - it calls us to Moonrise. Come!
WaitingDuringEscort.context: NodeContext: Religious certainty - the 'Her' is his god

AtTower.speaker: Kar'niss
AtTower.text: An interloper receives the Majesty's blessing before us?
AtTower.context: NodeContext: Looking at us with barely-reined in disgust - he is more deserving thatn we are, surely

AtTower.speaker: Kar'niss
AtTower.context: NodeContext: Leaning forward with glint of madness - could be take as encouragement or threat

AD_Harper_Melee_000.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harper_Melee_000.text: I fear neither shadow nor death.
AD_Harper_Melee_000.context: NodeContext: during combat, like a prayer, reassuring self

HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.text: Splendid show - newsworthy, even! Where's Volo Geddarm when you need him?

HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.text: Go on, check the drider. The lantern's yours for the taking.

Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower.speaker: Bedi
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower.text: Her cathedral will stand in the city, True Soul. On the bones of all Baldurians.
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower.context: NodeContext: grave, taking himself too seriously

Caravan_HalfOrcMelee.speaker: Bedi
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee.text: Stay sharp. These shadows can sneak up on you.

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.speaker: Player
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.text: Looks like the drider's caravan came from here.

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.speaker: Player
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.text: Cages, shackles... all prepared to march captives off to their fate.

AD_Harper_Caster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harper_Caster_000.context: NodeContext: wary but energetic, in combat

Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower.text: No food waiting for us? 'S barbaric. They got plenty of prisoners for the roasting.
Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower.context: NodeContext: whining - end of a long shift and they haven't been fed

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: You mean to reach Moonrise. And I've orders to help you.

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: The path to the Towers is drenched in blackness so deep, even a torch cannot quell it.

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: Yet the cultists have found a way to move freely. Whatever this method, you must claim it.

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: A cultist convoy crosses the land as we speak. I've readied an ambush. Say the word, and we fly.

AD_EscortInterrupted.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_EscortInterrupted.text: Return to the light! Do not stray!
AD_EscortInterrupted.context: NodeContext: Drider notices the player has left the safety of the caravan and wandered off into dangerous ground

Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_AtTower.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_AtTower.text: Wish we was assigned to the war camp. Beer's surely better down there.

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.text: Haven't we waited long enough, Bran?

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.text: We'll wait as long as it takes.

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.text: As long as it takes for what?

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.text: For the winds to blow in our favour.

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.text: Ain't you worried about the shadows?

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.text: Nope. 'Cause I ain't a little coward.

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower.text: Absolute's blessing on ya. Maybe Her design will throw us together again sometime.

AD_KillsSomeone.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_KillsSomeone.text: For the Absolute! For my queen!

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower.text: It was an honour to walk the shadows at your side. A little more inviting here though, eh?
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower.context: NodeContext: formal, making a slight joke at the end

AD_Harper_Ranger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_Harper_Ranger_000.context: NodeContext: in combat, menacing your enemies

AD_Warning.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_Warning.text: If they wander, we will not be responsible.

AD_Warning.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_Warning.text: If they die, it is their own fault.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.context: NodeContext: Bows their head slightly. This is their first time meeting a revered true soul

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.text: Why do you need a lyre, exactly?

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.text: I admit, I'm surprised a True Soul does not know this. Where are you headed, exactly?

AD_AfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_AfterAmbush.text: Shadows and heretics, Majesty. But they won't stop us. They can't stop us.
AD_AfterAmbush.context: NodeContext: Outburst - a little crazed as a whispering he's been hearing picks up again

AD_PlayerTakesMoonlantern.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_PlayerTakesMoonlantern.text: Return the lantern! You are not worthy to hold her light!

AD_ArriveToTollHouse.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.text: Stay close. The shadows are darkest here - hungriest here.
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.context: NodeContext: Warning the others in your caravan - you're entering a very dangerous area.

AD_ArriveToTollHouse.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.text: Do not stray from the light, no matter what they promise you.
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.context: NodeContext: Warning the others in your caravan - you're entering a very dangerous area.

HarperMelee_000.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000.text: We expect great things of you.

AD_CaravanConflict.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_CaravanConflict.text: You look twitchy, stone-skin. Afraid of the dark?

AD_CaravanConflict.speaker: Kansif
AD_CaravanConflict.text: In this place? Only a fool wouldn't be.

Caravan_GoblinRanger.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_GoblinRanger.text: I miss the camp. It's too quiet out here.

AD_AfterTollhouse.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_AfterTollhouse.text: There's the tower now, big lad. Your breeches still clean?
AD_AfterTollhouse.context: NodeContext: talking to a half-orc fellow-cultist, not to player

AD_AfterTollhouse.speaker: Kansif
AD_AfterTollhouse.text: My blade is. But that can change - just keep talking.
AD_AfterTollhouse.context: NodeContext: talking to a goblin who disrespected you, but it's a mostly-friendly rivalry

AD_AfterTollhouse.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_AfterTollhouse.text: They will be silent! They approach your sanctuary, Majesty.
AD_AfterTollhouse.context: NodeContext: 'they' are cultists he's leading, slightly crazed, talking to his 'god'

Caravan_GoblinMelee_000.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_GoblinMelee_000.text: Can we get movin'? Nabbed these boots from a gnome, and they don't bloody fit.

AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush.context: NodeContext: Very tense, but not shouting. Close to a loud whisper.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The hunter holds the lantern aloft. Its glow warms you through, chasing away the shadows in and around you.*

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in Harper's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Harper stows the lantern.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The Harper demands an explanation. Why did you travel with cultists?*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.NodeContext: Very suspicious

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: I meant to infiltrate the cult. You've ruined the mission.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The Harper sees through your lies and readies for battle.*

AD_TollhouseFight.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_TollhouseFight.text: Pay no heed - onwards, to Moonrise!

HarperRanger_001.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001.text: You're the one Jaheira entrusted to infiltrate Moonrise, aren't you? Gods be with you.

HarperRanger_001.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001.text: The farther you stray from Last Light, the stronger the curse becomes - and Moonrise is beyond where the shadows are darkest.

HarperRanger_001.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001.text: You won't survive the journey without protection - and we know where you can find it.

HarperRanger_001.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001.text: We've been tracking cultists who pass through the shadows unharmed, guided by an uncanny light. We plan to steal it.

HarperRanger_001.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001.text: With your help, we'll destroy their convoy. Then you can forge a path to the tower, with their light to guide you.

HarperRanger_001.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001.text: Go on ahead. I'll catch up.

HarperRanger_001.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001.text: If you insist. I'll mark your map - but waste no more time than is needed. This chance is too precious to miss.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.text: Take a moment, Bran. Savour our victory over the drider.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.text: I'll celebrate when Ketheric's dead. Not before.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.text: We're still alive, Bran. That's worth a cheer, at the very least.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.text: Have you ever known me to cheer?

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000.text: I must be brief: if you intend to reach Moonrise, no torch nor blessing will fully guard you.

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000.text: Yet I know what can - a strange lantern, used by a cultist convoy that oft passes.

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000.text: Together, we will take it by force - you simply need speak the word.

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_000.text: Go on ahead. I'll catch up.

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000.text: Very well. I will mark your map.

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000.text: But do not be long. Our chances grow thinner with each moment that passes.

AD_BeforeAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_BeforeAmbush.text: They must keep up. The shadows are hungry.

AD_BeforeAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_BeforeAmbush.text: ...Patience, Majesty. You bless us with patience.
AD_BeforeAmbush.context: NodeContext: Taking a breath to stop from lashing out

Harper_Melee_000_AD_CombatStarts.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_CombatStarts.text: Take out the drider - we need that lantern!

CaravanAmbushed.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanAmbushed.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider raises a hand, bringing the caravan to a stop.

CaravanAmbushed.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanAmbushed.context: CinematicNodeContext: He raises the lantern, peering into the darkNodeContext: He raises the lantern, peering into the dark

CaravanAmbushed.speaker: Harper Elindale
CaravanAmbushed.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers burst from hiding, Charging to attack the caravan

CaravanAmbushed.speaker: Narrator
CaravanAmbushed.text: *These Harpers are clearly enemies of the Absolute... they could be worthwhile allies. But defend the guide, and you may preserve your cover as a True Soul. *

CaravanAmbushed.speaker: Player
CaravanAmbushed.text: Defend the caravan, attack the Harpers.

CaravanAmbushed.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanAmbushed.text: Kill them! Tear the heathens to pieces!

Harper_Melee_000_AD_PlayerTookLantern.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_PlayerTookLantern.text: The cultist has the lantern - take them out!
Harper_Melee_000_AD_PlayerTookLantern.context: InternalNodeContext: 'the cultist' and 'them' both refer to the player - could be any gender

Harper_Melee_000_AD_TakesMoonlantern.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_TakesMoonlantern.text: I have the lantern! Let's finish this up and go home.

HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush.text: Not the cleanest of victories. But a victory, just the same.

HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush.text: Hold your nose and check that corpse. The lantern should still be on it.

HarperScout_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_AfterAmbush.text: A battle I won't soon forget. And in such favoured company, no less.

HarperScout_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_AfterAmbush.text: Go ahead, examine the drider. The lantern's there for the taking.

session_synopses.Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster: Combat AD for Kanslf, Half Orc caster in the driders caravan
session_synopses.ThanksAfterAmbush: While following the caravan, together with the players are ambushed by a group of players. If they side with the drider after the combat resolves it will thank them.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersAfterAmbush: Harpers are at the rendezvous point after the ambush reflecting about it.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersReachAmbushHouse: AD that triggers as harpers reach the house from which they will ambush the caravan.
session_synopses.Harper_Melee_000_AD_LassandraDies: Lassandra dies in combat with the drider. Branthos (also in combat with the drider) reacts.
session_synopses.Caravan_AD_Hyena: A playful, tame hyena is hanging around a goblin guard named Grim. Grim's having none of it.
session_synopses.HarperCaster_000: A Harper, getting ready for a mission that will see them trying to kill a drider - a big, dangerous monster. Main path only available when group dialogue is unavailable. This Harper is boisterous and eager.
session_synopses.CaravanStart: Dialog featuring a goblin and half-orc. Triggers the start of the caravan escort with the Drider appearing.The Drider is male, half-drow elf and half spider (bottom half). He carries a magical lantern to ward off the shadows
session_synopses.HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush: A Harper scout, getting ready to go back out into the cursed land that recently killed her friend. She's preparing to ambush a drider - a big, dangerous target. Her mood is somewhat grim.
session_synopses.AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush: Harper is waiting for the caravan at the ambush spot. After it the ambush starts and the caravan appears.Whispered and urgent - you're about to ambush someone.
session_synopses.CINE_CaravanIntro: The player spots the drider caravan approaching while exploring SCL (no harpers are present)
session_synopses.HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush: Harper leader after the fight with the Drider. You started the fight on drider's side, but switched and sided with the Harpers. They take the lantern and if you want it, you need to attack them or convince them to give it to you.
session_synopses.WaitingDuringEscort: Players were following the Drider accross the shadowlands but moved too far away from the caravan. The Drider will wait for the player to speak with it again before resuming the movement towards the tower.
session_synopses.AtTower: The Drider stands at the top of Moonrise tower - present just before we get our reward.
session_synopses.HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush: Harper Ranger after the fight with the Drider. You may or may not have started the fight on his side. After the ambush has ended, a prisoner threatens you, telling you to hand over the lantern.
session_synopses.Caravan_AD_HalfOrcAndGoblinAtCheckpoint: AD between the goblin and the half-orc when the entire caravan is at the checkpoint.
session_synopses.Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower: This guard was part of the caravan that brought us to Moonrise. Looking around the tower ruins, unimpressed.
session_synopses.Caravan_HalfOrcMelee: Half-Orc at the edge of the shadow curse. Stoic and focused on the job.
session_synopses.HarpersAndPlayersAmbush: The players have agreed to help the Harpers ambush a caravan of Absolute cultists and prisoners. You've just arrived at the ambush site - the mood is tense, words are spoken in harsh whispers. When the Caravan arrives there's a monsterous drider at its head, muttering to itself, talking to an imaginary queen/majesty that represents the voice of his God, The Absolute. The player can try to trick the drider into handing over its magic lantern (the Moonlantern - a glowing lantern hanging from the end of a staff), although that could leave the drider exposed to the worst effects of the curse. Will likely end in combat, either because you signaled the Harpers to spring their ambush or because the drider got suspicious and attacked.
session_synopses.PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint: Players met the caravan alone or with the harpers and backtracked towards where the caravan was waiting the Drider.
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower: A goblin guard who reached Moonrise Towers with us. Currently idle as they await their new orders.
session_synopses.HarpersAtInn: The players encounter a squad of Harpers at the Last Light Inn who're preparing to set out on a dangerous mission to ambush a drider and some cultists in the shadow-cursed lands. Lassandra, a Harper scout that the player may have helped previously, might be there.
session_synopses.AD_EscortInterrupted: Drider pauses the escort because someone was left behind. Drider's tone is a little sharp - it's his responsibility to make sure the caravan he's escorting gets to its destination safely.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush: A group of Harpers are standing outside an inn They had been preparing a dangerous ambush, but now the leader has another idea. The other Harpers are growing impatient.
session_synopses.Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp: Two of the three goblins discussing at the checkpoint. The tracker is nervous, looking to chat to distract himself. Vez is absolutely uninterested.
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower: The caravan has come to a stop at Moonrise Towers. Gronag is one of the guards idling outside until they're sent back out into the dark.
session_synopses.AD_KillsSomeone: Drider kills someone during the ambush encounter.
session_synopses.Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower: Kansif is now safe inside Moonrise Towers after delivering us there.
session_synopses.AD_Warning: Drider warns players and caravan not to move too far away from the light - otherwise the Moonlantern won't protect them.
session_synopses.Caravan_HalfOrcCaster: Player approaches Kansif (a stoic, honourable male half-orc) and Brawler Vez (a mouthy female goblin) after clearing a checkpoint and entering their camp in the Shadowcurse. They two Absolute cultists assume you're a True Soul sent by Minthara (which may or may not be true) and will ask if you brought the lyre needed to summon their guide through the darkness. If you have, you can play it and the drider will emerge. If you haven't, they can tell you where to find it.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersReachTree: AD that triggers near a tree at the shadowlands.
session_synopses.AD_AfterAmbush: Kicks off conflict between two or more caravan members if they are all alive at the bridge next to the town, after the harpers' ambush.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerTakesMoonlantern: Player takes the moonlantern and wasn't on the drider's side.
session_synopses.AD_ArriveToTollHouse: Drider arrives to the toll house and tells everyone to stay close to him.
session_synopses.HarperMelee_000: Harper one-line, with faith that the player will guide them to victory against the big bad Ketheric Thorm.
session_synopses.AD_CaravanConflict: Kicks off conflict between two or more caravan members if they are all alive at the bridge next to the town, after the harpers' ambush.
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinRanger: Goblin at the edge of the shadow curse. Misses the party back at the camp - this place is unsettling.
session_synopses.AD_AfterTollhouse: Kicks off conflict between two or more caravan members if they are all alive at the bridge next to the town, after the harpers' ambush.
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinMelee_000: If the player has been allowed entry to the camp, they can talk to this goblin to learn that they are waiting for a harp from Minthara with which to summon a guide that will protect them from the shadow curse on the path to Moonrise and if they haven't got it, they need to get it from Minthara. If the player has killed Minthara and hasn't already told the checkpoint goblin, they can mention it here.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush: AD as a group of Harpers move through the shadow curse. They're moving at a quick pace, trying to speak quietly. The mood is tense.
session_synopses.HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush: Narrator nodes for the after ambush. Dialgo shared between Elindale, Manus and Lassandra.
session_synopses.AD_TollhouseFight: Drider sees any of the tollhouse collector booster NPCs in combat while traversing the tollhouse in TWN.
session_synopses.HarperRanger_001: A Harper, possibly getting ready for a mission that will see them trying to kill a drider - a big, dangerous monster.
session_synopses.AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush: | 1st case scenario : Harpers came back victorious from the drider ambush and they are chatting about it back at the inn. || 2nd case scenario : Player went at the ambush without the harpers and they are now left with no lantern and nothing to do, |
session_synopses.HarperRanger_000: A Harper, proposing a mission that will see them trying to kill a drider.
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinMelee_001: A goblin plays with a hyena (if it is still alive). Grumpy.
session_synopses.AD_BeforeAmbush: Second caravan AD between the bridge and the ambush.
session_synopses.CaravanAmbushed: Harpers ambush the caravan and the players. If this dialog succeeds on starting, the players can decide to fight the Harpers or change sides and help the ambushers fight the drider.
session_synopses.Harper_Melee_000_AD_PlayerTookLantern: The Player is fighting on the side of the drider against the Harpers. The Players just picked up the lantern that Harper Branthos wants.
session_synopses.Harper_Melee_000_AD_TakesMoonlantern: Harper takes the moolantern from the drider.
session_synopses.HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush: Harper Caster after the fight with the Drider. You probably started the fight and switched sides to harpers. If so, you need to let them have the moonlantern or fight to keep it.
session_synopses.HarperScout_AfterAmbush: Lassandra after the fight with the Drider, triggers only if players started with the harpers and Lassandra was present at Haven.

PAD_FlowersAtHouse.speaker: Player
PAD_FlowersAtHouse.text: Flowers blooming in shadow. This is the sign Halsin mentioned.

AD_Hiding.speaker: Oliver
AD_Hiding.text: Come on, are you even looking?
AD_Hiding.context: NodeContext: teasing, giggly whispers during a game of hide and seek.

AD_Dome75PercentHP.speaker: Oliver
AD_Dome75PercentHP.text: Stop that! You're supposed to be playing, not breaking things!
AD_Dome75PercentHP.context: NodeContext: Angry (player is trying to break through a protective magic dome guarding Oliver)

AD_PlushDied.speaker: Oliver
AD_PlushDied.text: Why can't you just play nice?
AD_PlushDied.context: NodeContext: mid-combat, annoyed and upset that players are breaking his minions (toys that he summons)

session_synopses.PAD_FlowersAtHouse: PAD commenting on the unusual fact that flowers are growing around Olver's House despite it being in the Shadowcurse.
session_synopses.AD_Hiding: The first time Oliver hides he'll turn invisible and run away. As long as players are nearby the closest one will hear his voice inside his head (like how the emperor does) laughing at them for not being able to find him.
session_synopses.AD_Dome75PercentHP: This AD happens when you damage nightdome and bring it below 75%.
session_synopses.AD_PlushDied: AD that Oliver plays when his Plush is killed by the player during the fight at the plaza in Shadow Cursed Town

PAD_FindAnimal.speaker: Player
PAD_FindAnimal.text: The animal never had a chance. The curse consumes everything it touches.

session_synopses.PAD_FindAnimal: The party encounters a dead Shadow Cursed animal and comment on how the Shadow Curse consumes everything

AD_HarperScout_000_WrongWarning.speaker: Harper Lassandra
AD_HarperScout_000_WrongWarning.text: That's not the way - come back!

AD_HarperScout_003_Combat.speaker: Harper Karrow
AD_HarperScout_003_Combat.text: Yonas, no! What are you doing?

ShadowCreatures.speaker: Harper Lassandra
ShadowCreatures.text: Stay together! Keep to the light!
ShadowCreatures.context: CinematicNodeContext: From off-screen, as the player picks their way carefully through the dark, twisted terrain.

ShadowCreatures.text: CinematicNodeContext: In the darkness nearby, burning torches grow near, silhouetting a small knot of armed figures moving in a tight huddle. The player moves closer. A dead branch snaps underfoot, startling one of the figures - Lassandra, a wide-eyed young woman wearing half-plate under a blue cloak. She brandishes a torch and sword.
ShadowCreatures.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the darkness nearby, burning torches grow near, silhouetting a small knot of armed figures moving in a tight huddle. The player moves closer. A dead branch snaps underfoot, startling one of the figures - Lassandra, a wide-eyed young woman wearing half-plate under a blue cloak. She brandishes a torch and sword.

ShadowCreatures.speaker: Harper Lassandra
ShadowCreatures.context: CinematicNodeContext: Yonas (Harper 3) is moving wide of the group, an arrow notched to his bow, eyes fixed on the player. He's straying further from the Harpers' torches, walking along a sharp incline where road falls away, toeing the line between shadow and light.

ShadowCreatures.speaker: Player
ShadowCreatures.text: My name is [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. Who are you?

ShadowCreatures.speaker: Harper Lassandra
ShadowCreatures.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Lassandra keeps her weapon raised. The male harper (Harper 3) inches around, arrow notched, to get a better angle on the player.*NodeContext: Suspicious

AD_HarperScout_001_Combat.speaker: Harper Meygan
AD_HarperScout_001_Combat.text: Shit - the shadows took Yonas. Make every strike count!

BridgePoint_003.speaker: Harper Karrow
BridgePoint_003.text: Made it. Go speak to the boss.

session_synopses.AD_HarperScout_000: Brief AD when player first spots the harpers to establish their presence before the big dialogue.
session_synopses.AD_HarperScout_000_WrongWarning: After saving them from shadow creatures, the Harper Scouts are guiding the player through SCL to Last Light.This AD plays if the player goes in the wrong direction.
session_synopses.AD_HarperScout_003_Combat: Combat AD for Harper Karrow in SCL
session_synopses.ShadowCreatures: The player encounters a group of Harper scouts shortly after entering the Shadow-cursed lands. After being challenged by the scouts, they're forced to join sides as they're attacked by shadow creatures.
session_synopses.AD_HarperScout_001_LeaveWarning: After saving the Harper Scouts from the Shadow creatures in SCL, the player tries to leave without telling the Harpers they're ready to go.

AD_AsksForHelp.text: Won't you help me? Set me free?

PAD_ReactionToPixie.speaker: Player
PAD_ReactionToPixie.text: Hmm, a pixie. Curious little thing.

PAD_ReactionToPixie.speaker: Player
PAD_ReactionToPixie.text: Not what I expected to run into in a place like this.

InsideLantern.speaker: Dolly Dolly Dolly
InsideLantern.text: Yoo-hoo! I'm ready to come out now!
InsideLantern.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holds up the lantern and looks it over. A moon-like light glows from the lanternNodeContext: Seething rage, barely-disguised

InsideLantern.speaker: Player
InsideLantern.text: Ignore the pixie; you'll be needing this lamp.

session_synopses.AD_AsksForHelp: AD of the pixie in the moonlantern before the player has picked up the item. Pixie is in Disney mode here.
session_synopses.PAD_ReactionToPixie: Players react to the pixie inside the lantern. 2-speaker and solo speaker versions. Added reactivity depending on if the pixie was angered during the previous scene (SCL_Pixie_InsideLantern)
session_synopses.InsideLantern: The player has received a magical lantern - the Moonlantern - which protects against an evil curse. Hearing a voice from the lantern you examine it and find there's a pixie trapped inside, which gives it its power. The pixie is desperate and begs to be let out, as the lantern is killing it. If you release it, the pixie will grant you immunity from the curse, but only for one day. The pixie has two modes: Cute rhyming fairtyale Disney pixie (a put on) and evil vile little fey creature (true self)

GithExplorer_Dead.speaker: Dead Githyanki Warrior
GithExplorer_Dead.context: NodeContext: This is a brave warrior who died from a silly child's game

session_synopses.GithExplorer_Dead: This githyanki is already dead when the player finds them. They came from the nearby crèche and died at the hands of Oliver's shadow-infested father, whose axe is embedded in her still.

AD_AgainstShadows.speaker: Rolan
AD_AgainstShadows.text: I am Rolan, apprentice to Lorroakan himself - do not try me!
AD_AgainstShadows.context: NodeContext: exhausted and scared, but trying not to sound it

session_synopses.AD_AgainstShadows: Rolan is found near MOO and is found trying to fight off a group of shadows that appeared and are stalking him. He is exhausted and clearly scared but trying to put on a show and scare them off.

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with dead dialog if players leaves the area where the goblin was and comes back. They will find the corpse of the goblin killed by the shadows.

StayInSCL.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
StayInSCL.text: If you intend to stray from Moonrise while Ketheric still lives, I shall remain at camp, strategising his downfall.

StayInSCL.speaker: Player
StayInSCL.text: I have unfinished business to attend to before dealing with Ketheric.

StayInSCL.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
StayInSCL.text: I do not. All that I did before you rescued me was as a puppet of the Absolute - it is behind me. Until Ketheric falls, only vengeance remains.

session_synopses.StayInSCL: Minthara tells the player her business is in SCL now and she will not leave.

DaisyAD_ReachTowers.text: We are approaching the Absolute. A telepathic storm is surging all around us.
And the eye of the storm lies above that tower.

AD_Sign.speaker: Narrator
AD_Sign.text: *Night and shadow have claimed this place. Turn back.*

Underdark.text: CinematicNodeContext: The party emerges to look across the shadow-cursed lands stretching before them. A dark, grim panorama.
Underdark.context: CinematicNodeContext: The party emerges to look across the shadow-cursed lands stretching before them. A dark, grim panorama.

Underdark.speaker: Player
Underdark.text: What is this place? Makes the Underdark look like a sunlit meadow... I'm not sure I want to step in there.
Underdark.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party looks around in hushed awe,NodeContext: Reacting to view of the dark, foreboding region ahead. A little taken aback. They aren't aware of what's causing this place's affliction (a shadow curse)

PAD_AfterCutscene.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterCutscene.text: I've never seen darkness like this before. It's unsettling.

PAD_AfterCutscene.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterCutscene.text: But if this is the way to Moonrise Towers, then this is the only path I've got.

session_synopses.DaisyAD_ReachTowers: DaisyAD that plays on entering SCL from either entry point.
session_synopses.AD_Sign: Sign on the Risen Road before the Shadow Curse
session_synopses.Underdark: Players enter SCL for the first time from the underdark. Surveying the landscape, they reflect on the atmosphere and the shadow curse. The player may or may not have been previously briefed about the shadow curse by the druid Halsin
session_synopses.PAD_AfterCutscene: PAD for party banter when players enter SCL, after the cutscene (either SCL_EntryPoint_Mountain.lsj or SCL_EntryPoint_Underdark.lsj, depending on which entrance is used). Lines are generic enough about the shadow curse/look of the land that they work for both entrances to SCL. Two lines from one companion if only one companion present.

Circle_PAD.speaker: Player
Circle_PAD.text: A ritual circle. Looks like it was used in the crafting of Moonlanterns.

session_synopses.Circle_PAD: Players have clicked on a hidden ritual circle on a desk in SCL.The second option triggers if Gale already knows how to use it.

PAD_Plaque.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Plaque.context: NodeContext: Reading the text of an ancient plaque outside a room in the Temple of Shar

session_synopses.PAD_Plaque: A plaque outside a room in the Temple of Shar. The orthon has since made this area his lair, but the plaque refers to its original purpose.

PAD_DarkJusticiar.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiar.text: Countless initiates walked these halls once, seeking to become Dark Justiciars.

PAD_DarkJusticiar.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiar.text: I will follow in their path. I will succeed.

PAD_ShadowheartIntro.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartIntro.text: I shall prove myself worthy, Lady Shar.

AD_LightTrialShadow.speaker: Shadow, Shadow
AD_LightTrialShadow.text: A true child of the Nightsinger embraces the shadows and passes unseen.

PAD_PathOfDarknessHint.speaker: Player
PAD_PathOfDarknessHint.text: This must be what that book meant. I need to get across - and that means remembering where these platforms are.

PAD_DontHaveGem.speaker: Player
PAD_DontHaveGem.text: Don't have anything to put here.

PAD_ObjectOfDarknessHint.speaker: Player
PAD_ObjectOfDarknessHint.text: Lady Shar values those that can remain unseen and can still obtain what they want. Stealth is a virtue derived from her very essence.
PAD_ObjectOfDarknessHint.context: NodeContext: Reverent, as if quoting religious teachings from memory. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

session_synopses.PAD_DarkJusticiar: Shadowheart is walking along the corridors of the trials and is clearly excited about the prospect of finally proving herself worthy.
session_synopses.PAD_ObjectOfDarknessPlaque: The player discovers the name of the Shar trial.
session_synopses.PAD_TortureRoomPlaque: The player discovers the name of the Shar trial.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartIntro: Shadowheart answers the Shar statue with affirmation.
session_synopses.PAD_PathOfDarknessPlaque: The player discovers the name of the Shar trial.
session_synopses.PAD_PathOfDarknessHint: The player comments after possibly figuring out a clue to successfully completing one of the trials in the Temple of Shar. They must safely cross the room while remembering where the platforms along the way are.
session_synopses.PAD_DontHaveGem: The player attempts to place a Sharran gem in the temple puzzle, but they do not have one.
session_synopses.PAD_ObjectOfDarknessHint: The player speaks up on entering one of the trial areas in the temple of Shar. If they had previously read a book in the library area, they'll have an idea of what they need to do (navigate the maze and get through the locked door on the far side without being detected/setting off a trap). Otherwise they'll be none the wiser.

PAD_TriggeredShadows.speaker: Player
PAD_TriggeredShadows.text: So cold... there's something coming. I can feel it in the shadows...
PAD_TriggeredShadows.context: InternalNodeContext: Triggers after the player is teleported into the corpse pit in the Shar Temple.NodeContext: Dread and unease.

session_synopses.PAD_TriggeredShadows: After being teleported into a pit filled with bones, the player notices shadows gathering around them as the air gets colder. The player should feel a sense of dread

AD_NightsongAttacked.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongAttacked.text: Unleash your wrath! It only fuels my fury.

AD_TauntPlayer.speaker: Nightsong
AD_TauntPlayer.text: What are you afraid of? Your own wicked heart?

CINE_NightsongsDeath.text: CinematicNodeContext: 'The permiter of torches surrounding the inn flicker and go out, all at once. Shadowy figures start to move in between, descending on the inn'
CINE_NightsongsDeath.context: CinematicNodeContext: 'The permiter of torches surrounding the inn flicker and go out, all at once. Shadowy figures start to move in between, descending on the inn'

CINE_NightsongsDeath.text: CinematicNodeContext: Stunned, lit only by candlelight, she strains to see out the window - then flinches as screams echo inside the inn. She turns to the door as the sound of combat grows closer. She's already reaching for a weapon when the candles go out - and in darkness we hear her door crashing open. Wide shot from the far side of Last Light's bridge: all sources of light flicker and die as the darkness closes in. The screaming goes on.
CINE_NightsongsDeath.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stunned, lit only by candlelight, she strains to see out the window - then flinches as screams echo inside the inn. She turns to the door as the sound of combat grows closer. She's already reaching for a weapon when the candles go out - and in darkness we hear her door crashing open. Wide shot from the far side of Last Light's bridge: all sources of light flicker and die as the darkness closes in. The screaming goes on.

session_synopses.AD_NightsongAttacked: Nightsong cries in pain as she gets attacked by the player.
session_synopses.AD_TauntPlayer: Nightsong tries to goad the player into killing her
session_synopses.CINE_NightsongsDeath: After killing Nightsong the player sees the aftermath in Last Light

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A small prickle of dread finds your heart as you look upon the altar.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands before an altar of Shar.

session_synopses: The player discovers an altar in the temple of Shar. They can choose to pray at it, with the chance to receive a buff or debuff depending on the outcome of a religion check. Shar and Selune tags automatically get buff and debuff respectively. Avatar Shadowheart gets a unique and ambigous outcome, casting some doubt on her standing with her goddess.

session_synopses.PAD_OpenedScrollDoor: Party expresses affirmation that the button opened the door.
session_synopses.AD_RiddlePlaque: Reads out the riddle on the plaque.

AD_MonitorLeaves.speaker: Raphael
AD_MonitorLeaves.text: You cannot harm me, but you can irritate me. Goodbye.
AD_MonitorLeaves.context: NodeContext: mildly irritated, said right before he teleports away

session_synopses.AD_MonitorLeaves: Raphael leaves while at the front of Shar Temple, in case he is attacked.

AD_ShutteredMirrorOfLoss.speaker: Narrator
AD_ShutteredMirrorOfLoss.text: *Gazing into the broken mirror serves no purpose. The reflection it offers is like a dizzying kaleidoscope.*

session_synopses.AD_ShutteredMirrorOfLoss: Narrator AD on Shattered Mirror of Loss in Shar's temple in Act 2

node_data.text: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see Raphael casually leaning against a large tomb very near to the Thorm family catacombs entrance. When he sees us , he stands normally, smiles and greets us theatrically with a limerick.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see Raphael casually leaning against a large tomb very near to the Thorm family catacombs entrance. When he sees us , he stands normally, smiles and greets us theatrically with a limerick.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text:
Our hero thought but of treasure ahead,
Did not consider the peace of the dead...

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text:
Through the dark they went creeping,
And awoke what was sleeping...

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: A new grave they dug, which they themselves fed.

node_data.speaker: Karlach
node_data.text: Ooh, spooky.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sarcasm (talking to Raphael)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Are you saying there's treasure ahead?

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: Ah, greed. My favourite virtue.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: I've grown quite fond of you, you know - in my way. I thought it only fair to warn you about the dangers ahead.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) When he says ‘the dangers ahead’ he gestures generally behind him, towards the entrance of the Thorm family catacombs.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What dangers are those?

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: Oh, we both know they are soon to be revealed.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: It would be pointless of me to try to bar you from entering, but I can... set the scene as it were. Prepare you for your role.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Fine, paint me a picture.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: There is a stage down in the dark upon which a great drama has suspended itself in time.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: Its actors dwell there still, mired in the languor of their long-tired scenes.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: If you, however, through the dark go creeping and awake what is sleeping...

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: Chances are many more graves than yours alone will soon be fed.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Enough of your jibber-jabber. Begone.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: As you wish.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: I'll be pleased to follow up on your little escapades in your camp one of these nights. Should you live to tell your tale, that is.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: Until then - adieu.

session_synopses: Raphael is encountered at the beginning of the Shar Temple. He briefs the player about the Orthon - the devil he mentions - either telling them that he personally wants it dead, or that it is between the player and their objective. He then saves them from a trap and warns them about the dangers of the temple, before vanishing.!!! Don't remove REALLY_ASTARION tag check from the OOM branch!!!

Altar.speaker: Shadowheart
Altar.text: There's nothing more for us to do here - not until we complete Lady Shar's trials.

PAD_ShadowheartVista.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartVista.text: Lady Shar... so many must have toiled to make a visage so grand. It's beautiful...
PAD_ShadowheartVista.context: NodeContext: Overawed at the sight of a statue of liberty-sized representation of Shar, in  the heart of a huge temple.

session_synopses.Altar: The player approaches an altar dedicated to Shar. This altar is a call to action for the player to complete Shar's trials and become a Dark Justiciar.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartVista: Shadowheart sees the giant Shar Statue and lets it set in that she is in the temple of shar.

AD_Mirrors.speaker: Narrator
AD_Mirrors.text: *The mirrors here seem to not reflect light, but devour it.*

session_synopses.PAD_PuzzlePlaque: PAD used for when players interact with the plaque at the entrance of the crypt. Read by the narrator as an object AD.
session_synopses.AD_Mirrors: Narrator AD on smaller mirrors in SHA temple. Player can mention there is something magical about them, instead of just reflection of surrounding world. There are couple of them in the temple

PAD_MyrkulSymbol.speaker: Player
PAD_MyrkulSymbol.text: What is that symbol supposed to mean?

PAD_MakeshiftVessel.speaker: Player
PAD_MakeshiftVessel.text: What is that? Almost looks like someone was trying to grow a person.

PAD_KethericsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_KethericsMap.text: Looks like there's a temple under this place - and something deadly sealed inside it.

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.text: Isobel. That's the name of the cleric at Last Light Inn, right?

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.speaker: Player
